Lumber.name: Sharp Axes
Lumber.desc: Your Woodcutters will produce ::percent:: more Wood.

Weaponsmith.name: Weaponsmith
Weaponsmith.desc: Increases all your military units' attack power by ::percent::.

Colonize.name: Colonization
Colonize.desc: Reduces the amount of [Food] necessary to colonize one zone by ::inv_percent::.

BetterSilo.name: Eradication
BetterSilo.desc: [FoodSilo]s gain a ::percent:: [Food] production bonus. Also reduces [FoodSilo] upgrade cost by ::percent_value1::.

Coats.name: Fur Coats
Coats.desc: Your units no longer have reduced power during winter.

Defense.name: Defensive Strategy
Defense.desc: Increases your civilians' attack and your [WatchTower]s' resistance by ::percent::.

MrSmith.name: Grinding Wheel
MrSmith.desc: [Smithy]s require no building slot. [Smith]s give an additional ::percent:: production bonus to workers in the zone.

Fortnite.name: Missi dominici
Fortnite.desc: Civilian units in a zone under the protection of a [Lord] or [Overlord] gain +20% Defense.

NavalMastery.name: Emporia
NavalMastery.desc: Your next [CaroPort] evolution is free. [Sailor02]s' production is increased by +20%.

Recruit.name: Recruitment
Recruit.desc: Permanently increases population growth speed by ::percent0::. You gain an additional ::percent_value1:: during ::value2:: months for each unit from your clan killed by an enemy clan or sacrified (max ::percent_value3::).

MilitaryStrategy.name: Military Strategy
MilitaryStrategy.desc: Military units gain +::percent_value:: attack for each type of friendly military unit in the zone (max +::percent_value1::).

Security.name: Feeling Safe
Security.desc: Gain +::value::[Happy] if you have a [Hero01] and +::value1::[Happy] per upgraded military camp.
Security.props.firstNameDesc: Gain +::value::[Happy] if you have [Hero01] and +::value1::[Happy] per upgraded military camp.

Knowledge.name: Erudition
Knowledge.desc: Increases [RuneMaster] production by ::percent::. Your next [CarvedStone] is free.

Upgrades.name: Carpentry Mastery
Upgrades.desc:
Reduces your buildings' upgrade costs by ::inv_percent::.
Reduces upkeep from upgraded buildings by ::inv_percent1::.

Appropriation.name: Scriptoria
Appropriation.desc: Building a [Church] in a zone with a Viking artifact costs no [Stone]. Producing [Faith] in a zone adjacent to a neutral faction improves your relationship with them.

HeartStone.name: Hearthstone
HeartStone.desc: Reduces extra Firewood consumption during winter by ::inv_percent:: and reduces the winter food penalty by ::inv_percent1::.

SlotGrowth.name: Shiny Happy People
SlotGrowth.desc: -::inv_percent:: required happiness based on your population.

Heroes.name: Legendary Heroes
Heroes.desc: Improves your [Hero01]'s attack and defense by ::percent::.

MonsterSlayer.name: Monster Slayer
MonsterSlayer.desc: Improves your military units' attack by ::percent2:: against Draconic units and by ::percent:: against other mystical creatures. Also increases ::xp_type:: gains by ::percent_value1:: for each mystical creature killed.

Negociate.name: Negotiation
Negociate.desc: Reduces prices on the [MarketPlace] by ::inv_percent:: and stock replenishment is ::percent1:: faster.

SlotWealth.name: Trading Caravan
SlotWealth.desc: Trading routes earn ::percent:: more [Money]. Relations with neutral factions improve ::percent1:: faster.

Ascetic.name: Field Rations
Ascetic.desc: Reduces your military units' [Food] consumption by ::inv_percent::.

Pillage.name: Spoils of War
Pillage.desc:
Gain some [Money] for each enemy unit killed.
Eradicating a faction, neutral or clan, earns ::value:: [MilitaryXP]

Plunder.name: Plunder
Plunder.desc: When you decolonize a zone, your units there gain +::percent:: health.

Conqueror.name: Invader
Conqueror.desc: Increases your military power against [WatchTower]s by ::percent::, and makes decolonization ::inv_percent1:: faster.

Threats.name: Veiled Threats
Threats.desc:
Improves your Trade Routes' [Money] income by ::percent:: if you have a [Hero01].
After [Hero01] died at least once, -::inv_percent1:: [Money] costs and no [Iron] to recruit him again.
You can trade even when at war.

HeroEmblem.name: Hero Emblem
HeroEmblem.desc: [Stone] cost to build an [Temple] is reduced to ::value2::. It gives +::value:: [Happy] and produces [Fame].

ProudStag.name: Young and Proud
ProudStag.desc: Increases your military units' attack power by ::percent_value:: for every zone you control. (currently ::nb::% - ::percent_value1:: max).

GreatDeeds.name: The Value of Great Deeds
GreatDeeds.desc:
Skalds will produce +::value::[Money].
Skalds' tool improvement is free and forging time is divided by ::value1::.

GloryClan.name: Glory of the Clan
GloryClan.desc:
Increases [Fame] by ::percent::.
Increases gains from Trade Routes and Great Trade Routes by ::percent1:: each ::value2:: [Fame].

MoreAssign.name: Industrious
MoreAssign.desc: You can assign your Warchief to buildings producing [Food] or [Happy] to increase their production by ::percent::.

MoreBuildings.name: Amenities
MoreBuildings.desc:
Costs ::inv_percent:: less to develop a zone.
Periodically, a sheepfold containing 2 [Sheep]s makes a new [Sheep] appear.

Barricades.name: Wool Trade
Barricades.desc:
[Sheep] in [Sheepfold] earn you +::value:: [Money].
[Sheep]s can be sacrificed for ::value1:: [Money].

FoodTrade.name: Food Trade
FoodTrade.desc:
Trading food increases your Trade Routes' [Money] income by ::percent:: and by ::percent1:: on zones with a natural food source.
Trade routes with [GiantFaction] earn you +::percent:: more relationship.

Rangers.name: Rangers
Rangers.desc: Increases your scouting and exploration speed by ::percent::. Your Scouts no longer consume [Food] and cannot be hurt while exploring.

MilitaryFunds.name: Gear Upgrade
MilitaryFunds.desc: Gives you ::percent_value:: attack power and defense for each active [Sailor] or [Merchant]. (currently ::nb::% - ::percent_value1:: max)

GreatExplorers.name: Journeymen
GreatExplorers.desc: Increases your [Happy] based on the zones you have explored.

Wealth.name: Exotic Goods
Wealth.desc:
Increases [Sailor]s' resource production by ::percent3::.
Great Trade Routes give +::value4:: [Happy].
For each ::value::[Prestige], new [Villager]s arrive ::percent_value1:: faster. (Max: ::percent_value2::)

Negociators.name: Negotiators
Negociators.desc:
Your [Merchant]s will produce ::percent2:: more [Money].
[MarketPlace] prices are reduced by ::inv_percent:: and you send ::inv_percent1:: less resources via trades-routes.

Hibernate.name: Hibernation
Hibernate.desc: Your non-sick clan members health regenerates during winter in allied territory.

LandProtect.name: Protector of the Land
LandProtect.desc: Gain +::value::[Happy] per zone with at least one military camp.

ShieldMaster.name: Shield Mastery
ShieldMaster.desc:
[ShieldBearer]s' weapon forge is free.
Increases the resistance of all military units by ::percent::.

Harpoons.name: Harpoons
Harpoons.desc: [Fish] production is increased by ::percent:: and ::value1:: more [Fisherman]s can be assigned.

WinterFestival.name: Winter Festival
WinterFestival.desc: During winter, [Food] production is no longer reduced, and all other productions are increased by +::percent1::.

Bartering.name: Bartering
Bartering.desc:
Neutral factions will accept any resources and you gain +::value::[Happy] when trading with them.
Trade routes with neutral factions earn you +::percent1:: more [Money] and a better relationship.

LayLayLand.name: Lay of the Land
LayLayLand.desc: Reduces environment hostility by ::inv_percent::. Increases non villager productions by +::percent1:: in [Grove]s, [MarshBuilding]s or [Shoal]s. Allow to colonize [WolvesCave] without clearing the [Wolf]s.

Herbalism.name: Herbalism
Herbalism.desc: Each active [Mender] provides +::percent:: production in [MenderHut] territory (+::percent2:: for [Lore] production). Increases your [Mender]s' healing speed by ::percent1::.

Handiwork.name: Handiwork
Handiwork.desc: Non-upgraded buildings receive +::percent:: production. -::inv_percent1:: buildings upkeep costs.

Legacy.name: Legacy
Legacy.desc: Increases [Happy] and productions yields from [Temple] by +::percent::

Osmosis.name: Osmosis
Osmosis.desc: You obtain ::value1:: [Happy] for every ::value2:: colonized zones. Zones with [Grove]s, [MarshBuilding]s or [Shoal]s provide ::value::[Happy].

BlackMarket.name: Black Market
BlackMarket.desc:
[Merchant]s produce +::percent:: more [Money].
You can trade even when at war.
When units are using [CanHide] on Neutral Faction zones, you steal the amount received by the neutral faction.

Guerilla.name: Guerilla Tactics
Guerilla.desc: Permanently increases your military units' attack power by +::percent:: for any unit slain or lost in enemy territory. (currently ::nb::% - ::max::% max). The bonus is ::percent2:: more effective during the first ::value3:: seconds of a combat.

Rapacious.name: Rapacious Exploitation
Rapacious.desc:
Military units collect the natural resources and heal on burning [ScorchedEarth] zones.
Burning zone are ::inv_percent2:: cheaper to colonize.

UnderPressure.name: Under Pressure
UnderPressure.desc: [Skirmisher]s can attack enemy production buildings and houses to steal the resources they contain.

WinnerSide.name: Draconic Rage
WinnerSide.desc:
Draconic units have ::percent_value:: more attack power.
Instead of capturing enemy units, if you have available [Warband] slots, they are instantly turned into [Dragonmen] and join your army.

BloodTears.name: Blood, Sweat & Tears
BloodTears.desc: You can assign ::value:: extra [Slave]s to production buildings and ::value1:: more if upgraded.

Capture.name: Capture
Capture.desc:
Military units have a chance to capture killed neutral faction units.
Chance of capture is increased by ::percent:: if your [Hero01] is in the zone.

SlaveTrade.name: Thrall Trade
SlaveTrade.desc:
[Slave]s are ::inv_percent:: cheaper, and minimum price is also reduced by ::inv_percent::.
[Blood] gauge decreases ::inv_percent1:: slower.

Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Frenzy.desc: +::percent:: attack power for a military unit with no other military allies in their zone.

Metalcraft.name: Völund Fire
Metalcraft.desc:
Forging tools, weapons, and relics give you [Fame].
Forged tools for civilians get an additionnal +::percent3:: production bonus.

BFTower.name: Great Tower
BFTower.desc: A second upgrade for [WatchTower]s giving +::percent:: attack power and +::percent1:: structure.

Excavation.name: Excavation
Excavation.desc: When mining, warchiefs produce ::value0:: [Lore] for each ore they extract.

AncestralInfluence.name: Ancestral Influence
AncestralInfluence.desc:
Relics don't use a building slot. You can build an additional relic (max 1 relic per zone).
Forging a relic takes ::inv_percent:: less time to forge.

QualityLife.name: Quality of Life
QualityLife.desc: ::value:: [Happy] per zone with upgraded civilian buildings (except houses).

NearTheSea.name: Near The Sea Spirit
NearTheSea.desc:
[HighTide] zones generate +::value:: [Money], +::value:: [Prescience], and
have +::value:: buildings slot.

EndlessTide.name: Endless Tide
EndlessTide.desc: Increases military units' attack power by ::percent2:: and reduces their cost by ::inv_percent::. Military camps increase maximum [Warband] size by +::value1::.

FromBeyond.name: Knowledge from Beyond
FromBeyond.desc:
Reveals the position of all neutral factions.
Trade routes with them give [Lore] and +::percent:: [Money] and relationship.

FreshFish.name: Valhalla's reinforcement
FreshFish.desc:
You can control ::value:: more [NornArmor].
[NornArmor]s and [Kara] regeneration increases by ::percent1:: and is also active on [HighTide] zones.

CarpeFuturem.name: Foresight
CarpeFuturem.desc: [Norn]s generate +::value:: [Prescience]. You have ::percent1:: more chance to have a women when a new [Villager] arrive.

CityBuilder.name: City Builder
CityBuilder.desc: Improving a zone is ::inv_percent2:: cheaper. In improved zones, specialized units get a +::percent:: production bonus and buildings have a -::inv_percent1:: upkeep cost.

MilitaryTraining.name: Military Training
MilitaryTraining.desc: [TrainingCamp]s upgrade and upkeep costs are reduced by ::inv_percent1::.

Hydromel.name: Ferocious Charge
Hydromel.desc:
Close combat units with an improved weapon gain [WarriorCharge] and an additional ::percent:: damage on a charged attack.
Weapons cost ::percent2:: less and are ::percent1:: faster to forge.

InvincibleHero.name: Unstoppable
InvincibleHero.desc:
[OxHero] gain +::percent:: attack power and defense for each discovered [Artifact].
Whenever a unit dies in the same zone as [OxHero], his health slowly regenerates by ::percent_value1:: of the dead unit's max health.

GameDinner.name: Spoils of Plenty
GameDinner.desc:
Your warchief can put up to ::value2:: [Lure]s in your territory to attract [SavageDeer]s.
[Hunter]s' tool improvement is free and forging time is divided by ::value::.

ArcheryMastery.name: Archery Mastery
ArcheryMastery.desc:
Your first [Tracker] is always free.
Reduces [Archery]'s upgrade cost by ::inv_percent0::.

Vitality.name: Nimble Paws
Vitality.desc:
[LynxBrown] and [LynxWhite] gain +::percent:: max health
They also frequently leap, dodging all attacks while airborne.

Poaching.name: Poaching
Poaching.desc:
You can buy [HuntTrophy]s at the [MarketPlace]. Prices are reduced by ::inv_percent1:: and
[Merchant]s produce ::percent:: more [Money].

ExtraLure.name: The Wild Hunt
ExtraLure.desc:
Increases all your animal spirits' attack power by ::percent::.
While in the [LureSacred] zone, [LynxHero] can summon spectral beasts to follow her, depending on the number of mythical waves you have hunted.

MakingInterest.name: Stockpiling
MakingInterest.desc:
You gain +::value:: [Food]/[Wood] for each ::value1:: [Food]/[Wood] you have in stock (max +::value2::). This bonus isn’t affected by winter malus.
[FoodSilo]s don't require a building slot.

CookingMastery.name: Cooking Mastery
CookingMastery.desc:
[Meal] have improved effects.
[Meal] [Food] cost is reduced by ::percent::.

Economics.name: Economics
Economics.desc:
All [Money] income is increased by ::percent::.
You gain ::value2:: [Money] during meals.
All Meals gain +::value1:: [Happy].

KitchenNightmare.name: Kitchen Nightmare
KitchenNightmare.desc:
Your next warchief recruitment is free.
Reviving warchief cooldown is reduced by ::percent::.

Whispering.name: Rumor-mongering
Whispering.desc:
You increase your relationships with every neutral factions over time.
Allied neutral faction gains +::percent:: defense against your enemies.

ChainTasks.name: Overcrowding
ChainTasks.desc: You can place up to two buildings of the same type in a zone, except [WatchTower]s

EnforcedEnrollment.name: Enrollment
EnforcedEnrollment.desc: Your wounded units cost ::percent:: [Money] to train as military units.

PainSuppressant.name: Pain Suppressant
PainSuppressant.desc: Wounded units move and attack ::percent:: faster.

BloodTies.name: Blood Ties
BloodTies.desc: [RatMaiden] can sacrifice part of her health to heal all your units in the zone over the next ::value1:: seconds.

Invasion.name: Invasion
Invasion.desc:
When killing neutral faction units, you gain some of their favorite tradable resources.
Neutral faction buildings can house additional population.

Scavenger.name: Foraging
Scavenger.desc: You gain ::percent:: more resources when closing a [WolvesCave], a [DeathCamp] or colonizing a special zone.

Rapine.name: Rapine
Rapine.desc: The Boneyard effect is applied to enemy decolonized zones. All your [Hawk]s gather resources from enemy production buildings in the zone.

Sentinel.name: Sentinel
Sentinel.desc:
[Falconer]s gain the ability [WatchKeeping].
::desc::
[EagleHero] automatically triggers the ability and calls a [Hawk] in combat.

TrainingField.name: Training Field
TrainingField.desc: You gain +::value1::[Happy] if you have [EagleHero] and +::value:: [Happy] for each neutral or allied zone adjacent to your territory with no hostile units.

BloodEagle.name: Blood Eagle
BloodEagle.desc: Falcons protect allied units in Boneyards by using [Blind]. ::blindDesc::

PreventiveStrike.name: Ost
PreventiveStrike.desc: Your next [Outpost] upgrade is free. [MilitaryXP] gains are increased by ::percent_value::.

Armory.name: Steelwork
Armory.desc: Each military building in a zone with an active [Smithy] provides a +::percent_value:: defense bonus to the associated units.

AngelicProtection.name: Miraculous Healing
AngelicProtection.desc: Allied religious buildings slowly heal units within their zones.

SpecializedTraining.name: Marchfield
SpecializedTraining.desc: Military upgrades unlock faster and have a higher chance to trigger.

GotBerserk.name: Dominion
GotBerserk.desc: Your [Berserker] can colonize cleared zones for free.

MilitaryWolf.name: Assault
MilitaryWolf.desc: Your military units gain a ::percent:: attack bonus when fighting outside your territory. [Berserker]'s Dominion cooldown is reduced by ::percent_value1::

Supply.name: Supplies
Supply.desc: Each ::value3:: [Fame] a boat brings you +::value:: [Food], [Wood] and [Money], +::value2::[Lore] and +::value1:: [Stone].

Dedication.name: Annexation
Dedication.desc:
For each ::value2:: [Fame], colonization cost of new zones is decreased by ::percent_value:: and unit production is increased by ::percent_value1::.
::currently_sentence:: (::percent_value3:: max)

NorthgardChampion.name: Valorous Leader
NorthgardChampion.desc: Your warchief gains the [Flagship] ability and an increase of ::percent:: to his defense and ::percent1:: to his health.

HomeCook.name: Shepherd
HomeCook.desc: Gives ::value:: free [Sheep]s. You can have an additional [Sheepfold] and their [Food] production is increased by +::percent1::.

FeastResist.name: Teamwork
FeastResist.desc: You gain ::value1:: free feast per year. Your units regenerate health during a feast.

Recruits.name: Mercenaries from Homeland
Recruits.desc:
You can send [Mercenary] raids on enemy zone.
You can assign ::value:: more [Sailor]s in your [RavenPort] with a [Lighthouse].
You can trade with Homeland.

WartimeEconomy.name: Wartime Economy
WartimeEconomy.desc:
All upkeep is reduced by ::inv_percent::.
Upkeep of military buildings is reduced by ::inv_percent1::.
Mercenaries can be recruited on military buildings. They do not consume food or wood but require [Money] to stay in your warband.

KindredSpirit.name: Kindred Spirit
KindredSpirit.desc: Having [BearMaiden] or a [Maiden] in a zone increases local production by ::percent::.

BearAwake.name: The Bear Awakens
BearAwake.desc: You gain +::value::[Fame] per enemy unit killed in a zone with the [Maiden]. Your military units gain +::percent_value1:: power per ::value2::[Fame]. [BearMaiden] can now go in enemy territory.

OldKnowledge.name: Heritage
OldKnowledge.desc:
Gain free Knowledge +::value:: (does not count towards a Lore Victory or Blessing unlock).
[Hero08] heals friendly animals in the zone he's in and gains the ability to tame one.

GreaterBlessings.name: Greater Blessings
GreaterBlessings.desc:
<font color="#R">Freya: </font>Winter penalty is massively reduced (::inv_percent0:: for [Food], ::inv_percent1:: for [Wood])
<font color="#R">Baldr: </font> +::value2:: [Happy] and +::value4:: [Lore] production
<font color="#R">Jörd: </font> Your army and upgraded [WatchTower]s get +::percent_value3:: attack power

SignyRises.name: Fire with Fire
SignyRises.desc:
[WarchiefSnake] gains [CanHide].
When using [ScorchedEarth], every foes will leave the zone to adjacents one and discovered them.

SignyStealth.name: Shadow of the Wild
SignyStealth.desc:
All Military units gain the [CanHide] ability.
[ScorchedEarth] can be used on one more zone simultaneously.

TScorchedEarth.name: Scorched Earth
TScorchedEarth.desc:
[ScorchedEarth] can be used on enemy zone.
Your units have +::percent_value6:: attack power on burned zone.

EmpireGrowth.name: Reluctant Workforce
EmpireGrowth.desc: Receive 5 [Slave]s. Your [Blood] gauge is extended, and bonuses are increased.

Jealous.name: Tenacious Grudge
Jealous.desc:
You can train [MonsterDragonmen]s by sending [Dragonmen]s to [DragonmenCamp] a second time.
Your [Blood] gauge reaches its maximum size and increases the value of the bonuses.

Craftsmen.name: Craftsmen
Craftsmen.desc:
When in the same zone, Warchiefs mine and forge ::percent3:: faster
Selling [Stone] or [Iron] earns +::percent1:: [Money]. Neutral factions will accept [Stone] and [Iron].
Allies and neutral faction receive double resource.

EarthLegacy.name: Legacy of the Earth
EarthLegacy.desc:
You discover ::value:: Stone and ::value:: Iron deposits in your territory.
Zones with or adjacent to an active relic gain +::percent1:: production. (not stackable)

FutureSight.name: Future Sight
FutureSight.desc:
[SpecterWarrior]s increase zone production by ::percent1::.
Events are now revealed long
sooner than other clans.
Your clan feasts each time the Kraken approach the coasts.

SeaHowl.name: Howl of the Sea Master
SeaHowl.desc:
You can have ::value:: more [SpecterWarriorPop].
Military units killed have a chance to become [SpecterWarrior], joining your ranks under your orders.

MilitaryPressure.name: Military Pressure
MilitaryPressure.desc: Non villager unit productions have a bonus depending on the number of military units you control.

TrueHero.name: The True Hero
TrueHero.desc: Unlock [Dash] ability for [OxHero]. He can target an enemy building and he will destroy it immediately by charging at it. Enemy units becomes feared during the charge.

Baits.name: Lures
Baits.desc:
Unlock [SacredLure] ability for the [LynxHero]. Once placed, it periodically attracts Mythical beasts to the zone, more and more as time passes. Each cleared wave increases the size of the next one.
The next feast's cost is reduced by ::percent_value1:: (up to ::percent_value2::) per animal your clan killed.

WildHunt.name: Oskoreia
WildHunt.desc: Unlock [SummonWildHunt] ability for the [LynxHero]. She can recall the strongest wave of Mythical Animals the clan killed. In their spirit form, they come back for one last rampage on earth.

Strategist.name: A Helping Hand
Strategist.desc:
You receive [Ingredients] of each type by boat and you increase your ingredient storage by ::value::.
You can make Meals for your allies (effects are ::percent2:: less effective for allies).
You unlock Gift routes at the [TradingPost].

PlotThrone.name: Plot for the Throne
PlotThrone.desc:
You gain Fame based on your extra population compared to your most populous opponent.
Arrival of new villagers increases by ::percent2:: every ::value3:: [Fame].

ShamanicCare.name: Shamanic Care
ShamanicCare.desc: While being healed your units consume ::percent:: less [Food].

Proliferation.name: Proliferation
Proliferation.desc:
[PopReserve] can hold +::value:: villagers max.
The maximum duration of [Purification] is extended to ::value1:: months.

NomadicTribe.name: Nomadic Tribe
NomadicTribe.desc: Units outside their territory consume ::percent:: less Food and Firewood. Zones can be upgraded using Food. In upgraded zones, houses give +1 population and military buildings give +1 warband.

PredatorInstinct.name: Scavenging
PredatorInstinct.desc: [Ruins], [BrokenShores], and all special zones can be explored once more to gain additional resources (except the [Fame]). It is possible to reclaim a colonization bonus from a zone that already gave one.

TrialFaith.name: Religious Processions
TrialFaith.desc: [Feast]s cost ::percent_value:: less for each acquired Knowledge and Vow. Each military camp in a zone with [GreatLivability] gives a ::percent_value1:: attack bonus to the associated units.

PaladinCall.name: Rise of the Twelve Peers
PaladinCall.desc: You can evolve [Priest]s into [Paladin]s for a cost in [Faith]. Paladins can be assigned a Relic and carry it with them, including into enemy territory. Relics require no building slot.

FreyaBlessing.name: Freya's Blessing
FreyaBlessing.desc: Reduces loss of [Food] production during winter by ::inv_percent0:: and [Wood] consumption by ::inv_percent1::.

FinalBlessing.name: Ancestral Knowledge
FinalBlessing.desc: Required to achieve a Wisdom victory.

VowHunger.name: Vow of Chastity
VowHunger.desc: The [Food] consumption of all units is reduced by ::inv_percent::.

VowPoverty.name: Vow of Obedience
VowPoverty.desc: [Comfort] is increased by +::value:: in all of your zones.

FinalVow.name: Divine Right of Kings
FinalVow.desc: Required to achieve a Faith Victory.

RivalryPop.name: Town twinning
RivalryPop.desc: Arrival speed of both your and your Rival's villagers increases by ::percent::.
RivalryPop.flavor: For each [Population] you have more than your Rival, the arrival speed of both its villagers and yours increases.

RivalryLore.name: Eavesdropping
RivalryLore.flavor: For any Knowledge your Rival discovered and you did not, your population produces more [Lore].

RivalryFame.name: Bullying
RivalryFame.desc:
Your military units' defense is increased by +::percent1:: against your Rival.
Your Rival gains ::value2::[Fame] when killing your military units.
RivalryFame.flavor:
For each 50 [Fame] you have more than your Rival, your military units defense is increased against this clan.
Your Rival gains [Fame] when killing your military units.

RivalryMilitary.name: Manhunt
RivalryMilitary.desc: The target clan's units gain ::percent1:: attack power bonus within their territory and suffer a ::percent1:: attack power penalty outside of their territory. This doesn't affect your clan.
RivalryMilitary.flavor:
For each 100 Military Experience you have less, your rival gains increased attack power inside their territory but reduced attack power outside their territory.
This does not apply against your clan.

FountainWisdom.name: Mimirsbrunn
FountainWisdom.desc: You received blessing from the [FountainFame], you can choose Knowledge from another clan.

ClanKnowledge.name: Clan Knowledges
ClanKnowledge.desc: Steals Lore from other clans in the game, you need to scout them first.

Dominion.name: Dominion
Dominion.desc: Colonize a cleared zone for free.

ScorchedEarth.name: Scorched Earth
ScorchedEarth.desc:
Burn the zone for ::value:: months to increase Snake units' Attack Power.
After ::value:: months, the zone becomes [BadSwidden] and reduces production.
[WarchiefSnake] steals natural resources from the zone if not allied.

Rally.name: Rally
Rally.desc: Your military units in same zone as your Warchief attack and move ::percent1:: faster for ::value:: seconds.

Bodyguard.name: Bodyguard
Bodyguard.desc: Your Warchief can recruit a bodyguard to protect your warchief at a military building.

LocalRoadToValhalla.name: Road To Valhalla
LocalRoadToValhalla.desc: Consecrate a [Seeress] into a [NornArmor], allowing her to join your troops in battle.

Purify.name: Purify
Purify.desc: Sacrifice your [NornArmor] to immediately colonize a neutral or enemy zone.

Taunt.name: Provocation
Taunt.desc: Provoke non neutral enemies and [WatchTower]s around [OxHero] and increase his defense.

Dash.name: Ram
Dash.desc: [OxHero] dashes toward a selected building and destroys it

Cleanse.name: Cleanse
Cleanse.desc: Your units in your territory instantly recover from all states of Hunger, Sickness, Freezing and Unhappiness and receives a ::value0:: seconds immunity from them.

SharpEye.name: Sharp Eye
SharpEye.desc: [LynxBrown] and [LynxWhite] can reveal undiscovered zones. Upgrade the [ScoutCamp] to reveal an enemy zone.

SacredLure.name: Mythical Lure
SacredLure.desc:
Places a lure that baits aggressive mythical animals in the zone. They will come in increasingly stronger waves.
Hunting them is a good source of [HuntTrophy]s.

StandardLure.name: Lure
StandardLure.desc: Places a lure that attracts [SavageDeer]s within the zone. You can assign [Hunter]s on it.

WildCall.name: The Wild Call
WildCall.desc:
[LynxHero] can summon spectral beasts to follow her.
(::composition::)

SummonWildHunt.name: Oskoreia
SummonWildHunt.desc:
[LynxHero] summons the strongest wave of Mythical Animals you killed in their spirit form to assist you on the battlefield. They decay over time.
::composition::

BloodTiesSacrifice.name: Blood Ties
BloodTiesSacrifice.desc: Sacrifice ::inv_percent:: of [RatMaiden]'s maximum health to heal all your units in the zone over the next few seconds.

HoldTheLine.name: Hold The Line!
HoldTheLine.desc: Your Warchief can place a [DefensiveSpikes] to hurt enemy units entering the zone.

WatchKeeping.name: Watch Keeping
WatchKeeping.desc: The [Falconer] deploy their [Hawk] to watch over the zone, improving the attack power of military units by ::percent:: and the production of allied specialized units by ::percent1::.

GlacialWinds.name: Glacial Winds
GlacialWinds.desc: Freezing all enemy units in the zone for ::value:: seconds.

PaladinCall.name: Call of Paladins
PaladinCall.desc: You can evolve [Priest]s into [Paladin]s for a cost in [Faith]. Paladins can be assigned a Relic and carry it with them outside and even into enemy territories. The relic applies its effects anywhere the [Paladin] stands.

BuyMercenaries.name: Recruit Mercenaries
BuyMercenaries.desc:
You can recruit ::value:: [Mercenary]s.
Each one will cost an upkeep of ::upkeep:: [Money].

OdinsEyes.name: Odin's Eyes
OdinsEyes.desc: You can see through the fog of war during ::value:: months.

BoarTame.name: Tame
BoarTame.desc: Tame ::value:: friendly animal to join you everywhere except in enemy territory.

ReduceMilitaryBuilding.name: War Economy
ReduceMilitaryBuilding.desc: Reduce the cost of military buildings by ::inv_percent::.

PrepareWar.name: War Effort
PrepareWar.desc: Reduce the base cost of military units by ::inv_percent::.

ImproveMilitaryUpgrades.name: Veterans
ImproveMilitaryUpgrades.desc: Increase the bonus from military building upgrades by ::percent::.

TauntBodyguard.name: Protect the Chief
TauntBodyguard.desc: With a Bodyguard by his side, the warchief is protected. ::percent:: defense bonus.

WarriorCharge.name: Charge
WarriorCharge.desc: This unit runs faster when the engaged target is close enough and applies [ReducedArmor] on the first hit.

SkirmisherPoison.name: Poison
SkirmisherPoison.desc: Decreases target's attack speed and move speed by ::inv_percent0:: for ::value1:: seconds.

SwirlAttack.name: Whirlwind
SwirlAttack.desc: [Dragonmen]s sometimes execute a mighty swirling strike that damages all surrounding enemies.

Battlecry.name: Battlecry
Battlecry.desc: [MonsterDragonmen]s when hit let out a battlecry intimidating all nearby enemies and reducing their Attack Power by ::percent:: for ::value1:: seconds.

Intimidated.name: Intimidated
Intimidated.desc: Attack is reduced by ::reduction:: for ::duration:: seconds.

DwarfKingStomp.name: Stomp
DwarfKingStomp.desc: Deals damage to multiple nearby enemies.

SuppressingFireMilitary.name: Suppressing Fire
SuppressingFireMilitary.desc: Human units within a zone that contains an allied [WatchTower] or [GuardTower] gain +::percent_value:: defense.

SuppressingFireTower.name: Suppressing Fire
SuppressingFireTower.desc: You gain a free [GuardTower] upgrade each year.

ReduceUpKeepTower.name: Reduced Upkeep
ReduceUpKeepTower.desc: All your [WatchTower] have their upkeep costs reduced by ::percent_value::.

ArmedChief.name: Armed Wing of the Clan
ArmedChief.desc: Your warchief benefits from all weapons forged.

MilitaryTrainer.name: Inspiring Leader
MilitaryTrainer.desc: Military units in the same zone as your warchief produce [MilitaryXP]. (max ::value::)

HeadDefender.name: First Line of Defense
HeadDefender.desc: Your warchief increases the defense of your units in the zone by ::percent::.

CallToArms.name: Call To Arms
CallToArms.desc:
Every six months, [Militia]s arrive by boat to help you defend your territory. [Militia]s are defensive military units that cannot leave allied territory.
You can have a maximum of ::value1:: [Militia]s in your territory.

BloodBath.name: Call Of Valhalla
BloodBath.desc: While in [Battleground] zone your units have ::percent_value0:: attack power and attack speed bonus.

Battleground.name: Battleground
Battleground.desc: In a zone where ::value:: clan units die, the zone becomes a battleground. You have ::percent_value1:: bonus [MilitaryXP].

CanHide.name: Cloaked
CanHide.desc: Can hide from foes, unless war is declared in the zone. This unit consume ::inv_percent:: less [Food] while hiding among wild creatures.

GiantCrowAoE.name: Bash
GiantCrowAoE.desc: They sometimes strike the ground with immense strength, damaging all nearby enemies.

OxHeroAoE.name: Stomp
OxHeroAoE.desc: Sometimes used instead of the usual attack, damaging all nearby enemies.

FrozenStrike.name: Frozen Strike
FrozenStrike.desc: Enemies hit by Valdemar are frozen, along with the area around them. (::value2:: penalty on move and attack speed).

KingsBodyguard.name: King's Bodyguard
KingsBodyguard.desc: [LichKing] cannot take damages as long as he is close to an [IceGolem].

DoorWarden.name: Door's Warden
DoorWarden.desc: [NidavellirDoor] cannot be destroyed as long as the [DwarfKing] is alive.

Stealth.name: Stealth
Stealth.desc: Enemy [WatchTower]s won't attack stealthed units until they attack it.

DamageReturn.name: Reflection
DamageReturn.desc: Enemy attacking this unit will receive ::percent_value:: of their own damages back.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.desc: This unit is hidden and can only be seen by other units in the same zone.

Hidden.name: Hidden
Hidden.desc: This unit is hidden and cannot be seen until it move out of its cover.

SwampPoison.name: Rot
SwampPoison.desc: Units are slowed down and take damage over time.

PathComplete.name: Path Complete
PathComplete.desc: All [Tracker]s gain +::percent_value:: attack speed when they can attack from distance, +::percent_value1:: range distance and +::percent_value2:: move speed each time this ability is bought.

Ablaze.name: Ablaze
Ablaze.desc: This building is burning uncontrollably. You may need to repair the building to stop the fire!

WildHuntDecay.name: Oskoreia Spirit
WildHuntDecay.desc: Spirits called upon for the wild hunt cannot hold a physical form for too long. They lose health over time and can't be healed.

BrotherlyLove.name: Caring Siblings
BrotherlyLove.desc:
[LynxBrown] and [LynxWhite] heal each other when on the same allied zone.
[LynxBrown] has +::percent:: attack power while in the same zone as [LynxWhite].

ProtectiveBrother.name: Sibling Rivalry
ProtectiveBrother.desc: When they are in the same zone, [LynxWhite] has +::percent:: defense, and [LynxBrown] produce food in your territory.

WildHunter.name: Wild Hunter
WildHunter.desc: Military Units don't suffer supply malus nor winter attack power penalty.

GreatHunt.name: The Great Hunt
GreatHunt.desc: Get trophies on all mystical creatures. Military units have +::percent:: attack power on mystical creatures.

TheWise.name: The Wise One
TheWise.desc: [LynxHero] produce +::value:: [Lore] outside combat in your territory.

Discord.name: Discord
Discord.desc: Units turn against their own allies during ::value::seconds or until they are you last unit, or until the fight is over.

Wounded.name: Wounded
Wounded.desc: Wounded clan members have reduced production.

BearHunting.name: Bear is hunting
BearHunting.desc: This unit will regenerate overtime and produce food near [Shoal].

NornArmorHealing.name: Regenerate
NornArmorHealing.desc: This unit's health will regenerate near [Horgr] and on [HighTide] zones with [FreshFish].

BonusDefAgainst.name: Bullying
BonusDefAgainst.desc: Increase your defense against units of ::player:: by ::percent::.

RivalryMilitaryStats.name: Manhunt
RivalryMilitaryStats.desc:
This unit has a ::percent:: attack bonus in their territory.
This unit suffers a ::percent:: attack penalty outside their territory.
Except against player's units:
::playerList::

Overwork.name: Overwork
Overwork.desc: Overworking gives ::percent:: bonus to your units production at the cost of their health.

BurningRage.name: Burning Rage
BurningRage.desc: While [Purification] is active, [RevivedCarcass] heals over time and gains +::value:: attack power for each active [Purification].

Purification.name: Purification Pyre
Purification.desc:
When your clan's units kill wild creatures or die, all your [HealerCamp] pyres ignite.
While active you produce +::value5:: [Lore] and new villagers arrive faster.

BloodTiesBuff.name: Blood Ties
BloodTiesBuff.desc: Thanks to [RatMaiden]'s sacrifice, your units regain some health for ::value1:: seconds.

LastStand.name: Last Stand
LastStand.desc: Whenever the unit is hurt, they charge their next attack to deal more damages.

DoubleAttack.name: Double Attack
DoubleAttack.desc: This unit's second attack is faster.

ShieldFirst.name: Shield Wall
ShieldFirst.desc: This unit's defense is increased by ::percent:: for ::value1:: seconds when targeted in combat.

FeralInstinct.name: Feral Instinct
FeralInstinct.desc: When [Tracker]s kill an enemy, they have ::percent_value:: chance (::percent_value1:: against animals) to summon their spirit animal.

Flagship.name: Valorous Leader
Flagship.desc: In combat, the warchief galvanizes your military units in the zone, increasing their damage by ::percent:: for ::value1:: seconds.

ExperiencedHunter.name: Experienced Hunters
ExperiencedHunter.desc: After partaking in a foe kill, military units' attack power increases by ::percent_value:: until they die. (max +::percent_value1::)

line0.text: Currently +::nb::%.

Garrison.name: Garrison
Garrison.desc: Each [WatchTower] adds +::value0:: to your maximum warband (+::value1:: if upgraded).

Boneyard.name: Boneyard
Boneyard.desc:
Hunting area. For ::duration:: months, your units in the zone will be healed.
For each wild creature you killed one of your [Hawk] will gather some of the zone natural resources in a [ResourceBag].

GuerillaStrike.name: Guerilla Strike
GuerillaStrike.desc: When dealing damage for the first time in a combat, this unit will do bonus damage for ::value:: seconds ([Guerilla]).

Blind.name: Blind
Blind.desc: A blinded unit will miss all its attacks for ::value:: seconds.

WatchKeepingGrif.name: Watch Keeping
WatchKeepingGrif.desc: In combat, [EagleHero] deploys their [Hawk] to watch over the zone, improving the attack power of military units by ::percent::.

Warrior02AoE.name: Double Hit
Warrior02AoE.desc: [Warrior02]s attacks have ::percent_value:: chance to hurt ::value3:: close enemies at once dealing ::percent_value1:: of its damage.

SlamImpact.name: Fury
SlamImpact.desc: When landing a hit, this unit has a chance to hurt additional nearby enemies.

DeflectArmor.name: Hauberk
DeflectArmor.desc: When taking a hit, this unit has a chance to deflect the damages toward multiple nearby enemies.

CoveringDefense.name: Rearguard
CoveringDefense.desc: When taking a hit, this unit has a chance to increase its own Defense and that of close ally units for ::value:: seconds.

BlindingImpact.name: Scramasax
BlindingImpact.desc: When landing a hit, this unit has a chance to blind the opponent for ::value:: seconds.

SlowTarget.name: Obstruction
SlowTarget.desc: When landing a hit, this unit has a chance to slow its target for ::value:: seconds.

Spotted.name: Spotted
Spotted.desc: You are spotted! You can't hide in [HidingGrass] and your defense is reduced by ::inv_percent::

SurtrCapture.name: Capture
SurtrCapture.desc:
[WarchiefDragon] can capture enemies clan units into [Slave]s.
Can be improved by [Capture].
Current chance ::current:: %.

ChampionBoon.name: Champion Boon
ChampionBoon.desc: Gained [MilitaryXP] gives your Warchief +::att::% Attack power and +::def::% Defense.

RelicHammerBonus.name: Mjöllnir's Wrath
RelicHammerBonus.desc: When landing a strike, this unit has a ::lightningChance::% chance of summoning Mjölnir's wrath on their opponents.

DwarfKingMight.name: Warden's Command
DwarfKingMight.desc: Reinforces the [Dwarf]s protecting the gate and periodically causes enemies to flee.

Enlightenment.name: Enlightenment
Enlightenment.desc: Heal nearby military units outside of combat.

Corruption.name: Corruption
Corruption.desc: Valkyries' corruption gives them +::percent_value:: move speed and +::percent_value1:: attack power.

DwarfFearSlow.name: Fear
DwarfFearSlow.desc: This unit is slowed and flees combat for ::value:: seconds.

WargDefense.name: Protection of the Pack
WargDefense.desc: Mystical beasts in the same zone as the [Warg] make it stronger.

WargFleePowerup.name: Battle Scars
WargFleePowerup.desc: Every time the [Warg] flees, it gets stronger.

Shepherd.name: Shepherd
Shepherd.desc: After participating in clearing a zone, wild [Sheep]s in the zone are captured.

MultiArrows.name: Double Shot
MultiArrows.desc: Your [Tracker]s can shoot ::value1:: additional arrow at enemies close to their primary target. Secondary targets take ::percent_value3:: damage.

FireArrows.name: Fire Arrows
FireArrows.desc: Your [Tracker]s use fire arrows that inflict +::percent1:: damage to buildings. Target has a chance to suffer ::value4:: damages for ::value5::sec.

CallGiantBoar.name: Call of Gullinbursti
CallGiantBoar.desc: Summons a [GiantBoar]. It is not controllable while in combat.

FrozenEarth.name: Chilling Aura
FrozenEarth.desc: Enemies hit by Gram are frozen for ::value2:: seconds, along with the area around them. They are slowed and their attack speed is reduced.

MoveRelic.name: Move Relic
MoveRelic.desc: Move the Shield to another zone in your territory, only if the two zones are undisputed.

SpikeTrap.name: Spike Trap
SpikeTrap.desc: Place a [Trap] in a non-enemy zone. Activate the trap to reveal spikes that damage and slow down the enemy as long as they stay within. Lasts ::value1:: seconds.

Revive.name: Revive
Revive.desc: Brings back clan units who have fallen in its zone but with a minimal amount of health.

Stilt.name: Shallow Waters
Stilt.desc: Improve a coastal zone to accept one additional building.

HighTide.name: High Tide
HighTide.desc:
Cancel the building and attack penalties in a non-coastal zone of the clan of the Kraken.
You can colonize a neutral non-coastal zone for the normal cost.
Makes fish appear in lakes if there are none.
You can only cast [HighTide] on a non-coastal zone adjacent to coastal zones or zones affected by [HighTide]

RoadToValhalla.name: Road To Valhalla
RoadToValhalla.desc: Consecrate one of your [Seeress]. She becomes a [NornArmor] and joins your army.

Sacrifice.name: Sacrifice
Sacrifice.desc: Sacrifice this unit to gain ::food::

Selling.name: Selling
Selling.desc: Sell this unit to gain ::money::

PillageAnnounce.name: Better Preparation
PillageAnnounce.desc: Reduces the time it takes for [Mercenary]s to be recruited by ::nb:: months.

PillageFire.name: Fire Javelins
PillageFire.desc: The mercenary fleet throws fire javelins that damage and burn the zone's buildings.

PillageTownhall.desc: The mercenary fleet can target enemy's [TownHall].

HollyStrike.name: Light of Idavoll
HollyStrike.desc: Harr's strikes cause targets to slow down temporarily.

VengefulCut.name: Wrath of Vali
VengefulCut.desc: Harr's strikes cause targets to bleed and take damage with time. They cannot be healed while bleeding.

HealingFenrir.name: Panacea of Jafnharr
HealingFenrir.desc: Creates a healing zone around the bearer.

ImmuneShield.name: Protection of Thridi
ImmuneShield.desc: Creates a protective zone around the bearer.

Swidden.name: Swidden Field
Swidden.desc:
Ignite a zone for ::value:: months, giving specialized units a +::percent_value1:: production bonus.
The zone then takes ::time:: months to recover, impacting specialized unit production with a ::malus::% malus.

BadSwidden.name: Depleted Field
BadSwidden.desc: The resources of this area have been burned. Specialized Units in this zone will have -::inv_percent1:: production malus during ::value:: months.

Escape.name: DEPRECATED
Escape.desc: Runs to the border of the nearest safe zone upon getting hit.

Blizzard.name: Blizzard
Blizzard.desc: Reduces all production by ::inv_percent:: and increases Firewood consumption by [BlizzardConsumptionFactor].
Blizzard.announce: The weather is cold this year. We'll have a [Blizzard] this winter, so we need to store a large amount of [Food] and [Wood]!

Rats.name: Rat Infestation
Rats.desc: Rats will spread disease and reduce food production around [House]s.
Rats.announce: Rats have been reported. We need to store [Food] and train [Healer]s to protect against disease.

Earthquake.name: Earthquake
Earthquake.desc: The earthquake will damage some of your buildings.
Earthquake.announce: Tremors have been reported. A big earthquake would seriously damage our buildings unless we store [Wood] to repair them.

DraugrAttack.name: Draugar Invasion
DraugrAttack.desc: [Death]s will soon spawn from the portals.
DraugrAttack.announce: Portals leading to Helheim have opened. We need to take defensive action before the [Death]s arrive!

FallenSailors.name: Fallen Sailors
FallenSailors.desc: These [SpecterWarrior]s used to fight for our side...
FallenSailors.announce: Ahoy! Fallen Sailors are approaching your coasts!

BloodMoon.name: Blood Moon
BloodMoon.desc: All units gain +::percent_value:: attack power when outside of their territory for the duration of the Blood Moon.
BloodMoon.announce: The [BloodMoon] is coming! Prepare for a fight!

FenrirEvent.name: Fenrir is coming
FenrirEvent.desc: Fenrir has been summoned. Ragnarok is coming.

Eruption.name: Volcanic Eruption
Eruption.desc: [Meteor] will soon fall on Northgard. They are a good source of stone, as well as a hidden threat.
Eruption.announce: Loud rumbles come out of the volcano! Prepare yourselves!

FrozenSea.name: Frozen Sea
FrozenSea.desc: During this winter, [Sailor]s won't produce resources. Great Trade Routes will stop.
FrozenSea.announce: The Sea will freeze this winter. [Sailor]s won't be able to work until it thaws.

KrakenAttack.name: Kraken Attack
KrakenAttack.desc: The Kraken will prowl the seas, randomly wrecking any ship it encounters.
KrakenAttack.announce: An ominous shade prowls under the sea.

GolemAwake.name: [Golem]s Awakening
GolemAwake.desc: Mine the stone quickly, or face a raging foe!

GameEnd.name: No turning point
GameEnd.desc: Achieve victory before reaching this point or you will be defeated.

LureWaveStart.name: Beasts attack
LureWaveStart.desc: Mythical beasts are prowling around your [LureSacred]. They won't resist it forever and will try to get to it aggressively.

NewVillager.name: New Villager
NewVillager.desc: A new villager will soon join us.

FeastEnd.name: Feast End
FeastEnd.desc: We are enjoying a glorious feast!

FreeFeast.name: [FeastResist]
FreeFeast.desc: A free Feast will be available.

Unfreeze.name: Spring
Unfreeze.desc: The undead army will unfreeze and attack you at the beginning of the 5th summer. We must prepare to survive!
Unfreeze.announce: The undead army will unfreeze and attack you at the beginning of the 5th summer. We must prepare to survive!

FoodRequest.name: Food Request
FoodRequest.desc: Spare Svarn some [Food] as soon as you can afford to. Should you fail to provide the supplies in time, the rebels will have more trouble resisting the loyalists' assaults.
FoodRequest.announce: Svarn requests a supply of ::value:: [Food] to survive. Help him and you will get some [Fame] and a [Happy] bonus until the next request.

WoodRequest.name: Wood Request
WoodRequest.desc: Spare Svarn some [Wood] as soon as you can afford to. Should you fail to provide the supplies in time, the rebels will have more trouble resisting the loyalists' assaults.
WoodRequest.announce: Svarn requests a supply of ::value:: [Wood] to heat the clan's homes and repair their structures. Help him and you will get some [Fame] and a [Happy] bonus until the next request.

MoneyRequest.name: Kröwn Request
MoneyRequest.desc: Spare Svarn some [Money]s as soon as you can afford to. Should you fail to provide the supplies in time, the rebels will have more trouble resisting the loyalists' assaults.
MoneyRequest.announce: Svarn requests a supply of ::value:: [Money]s to help maintain the clan's troops. Help him and you will get some [Fame] and a [Happy] bonus until the next request.

GiantAttack.name: Attack of Giants
GiantAttack.desc: We should prepare appropriately to resist the next assault; [GiantFaction]s pack quite a punch!
GiantAttack.announce: Our enemy will be sending Jötnar to crush us. We should brace for an assault of epic proportions.

BifrostEvent.name: Gjallarhorn's Wail
BifrostEvent.desc: Prepare to protect Bifröst and yourself from the [GiantFire]s.
BifrostEvent.announce: Hvedrung is calling the fierce [GiantFire]s from Muspell to destroy Bifröst.

IceWormAttack.name: Hrímgandr's Wrath
IceWormAttack.desc: Hrímgandr will wreak havoc in your territory.

HagenReinforcement.name: Search Party
HagenReinforcement.desc: Mercenaries will land on your coasts soon.
HagenReinforcement.announce: ::value:: month(s) before Hagen's search party arrives.

SupplyFromHomeland.name: Supply from Homeland
SupplyFromHomeland.desc: A ship from Homeland brings you new villagers.
SupplyFromHomeland.announce: Homeland will send you new villagers by boat.
SupplyFromHomeland.conquestDesc: "[SupplyFromHomeland]" events appear frequently : New [Villager]s will come to your clan.

Mercenaries.name: Mercenary Raid
Mercenaries.desc: [Mercenary]s have chosen their target. The raid begins!
Mercenaries.announce: A mercenary ship has been spotted near your coasts! You must prepare!
Mercenaries.conquestDesc: "[Mercenaries]" events appear frequently : Boats of fearsome [Mercenary]s will attack you coasts.

Elevation.name: Curse
Elevation.desc: Some of your population turn into [SpecterWarrior]s.
Elevation.announce: Our men got infected by a strange disease!
Elevation.conquestDesc: "[Elevation]" events appear frequently : Some of your population will become [SpecterWarrior]s

FrozenAttack.name: Frozen Attack
FrozenAttack.desc: An army of frozen undeads gather near the [Niflheim]s and will attack you.
FrozenAttack.announce: I feel it, the frozen dead are coming.
FrozenAttack.conquestDesc: "[FrozenAttack]" events appear frequently : Waves of frozen monsters appear to attack you.

FireGiant.name: Invasion from Muspell
FireGiant.announce: The [Muspell]s are glowing. Prepare to fend off the invaders!
FireGiant.conquestDesc: "[FireGiant]" events appear frequently : Waves of gigantic [GiantFire]s comes to destroy you.

HelheimInvasion.name: Invasion from Helheim
HelheimInvasion.announce: Stop the Invasion! You must colonize at least ::value:: [Helheim] gate.
HelheimInvasion.conquestDesc: "[HelheimInvasion]" events appear frequently : [Helheim]s will summon quantity of [Death]s and [Valkyrie]s

DeathMatch.name: Death Match
DeathMatch.desc: All warchiefs must gather at the arena, and only one can come out.
DeathMatch.announce: Warchiefs must gather at the arena!
DeathMatch.conquestDesc:
"[DeathMatch]" is organized each year :
Your warchief will be summoned in the arena to fight the others to the death.

DefendBabyWyvern.name: Protect the Wyvern Nest
DefendBabyWyvern.desc: Protect the nest for ::remainingTime:: month until the egg hatches.
DefendBabyWyvern.announce: Protect the nest until the egg hatches!

CeremonialBonfire.name: Ceremonial Bonfire
CeremonialBonfire.desc:
Contribute to the [CeremonialBonfire] by sending [Wood] through a [TradingPost]!
The best contributor will be awarded free Knowledge.
CeremonialBonfire.announce: The Bonfire's construction will begin soon!

MyrkalfarRansom.name: The Myrkálfar's Levy
MyrkalfarRansom.desc: The [MyrkalfarFaction]s are demanding that you send [Iron] to them, "or else."
MyrkalfarRansom.announce: The [MyrkalfarFaction]s will be requesting a levy shortly!

DwarfGems.name: The Dwarven Prospectors
DwarfGems.desc:
The [DwarfFaction]s are greedily looking for [Gemstone]. Mine it and send it to them... or sell it for your own profit!
The best contributor will receive [Stone] and [Iron]!
DwarfGems.announce: The [DwarfFaction]s are expecting [Gemstone] to emerge soon!

Food.texts.name: Food
Food.texts.desc: [Food] is necessary to feed your clan. Stock up on food before winter. Avoid starvation at all costs.
Food.texts.plural.name: Food

Wood.texts.name: Wood
Wood.texts.desc: [Wood] is used to construct buildings and as Firewood, especially during winter.
Wood.texts.plural.name: Wood

Money.texts.name: Kröwns
Money.texts.desc: [Money] are used to recruit your Warband and for building upkeep.
Money.texts.plural.name: Kröwns

Comfort.texts.name: Livability
Comfort.texts.desc:
[Comfort] determines the amount of specialized units who can work within a zone. Build taverns, upgrade houses or develop the zone to increase it.
Reach a [!Comfort] of ::value:: or more to gain a production and population growth bonus.
Comfort.texts.plural.name: Livability

Happy.texts.name: Happiness
Happy.texts.desc: [Happy] will attract new villagers to your Town Hall. Improve your people's Happiness to accelerate this process.
Happy.texts.plural.name: Happiness

Lore.texts.name: Lore
Lore.texts.desc: [Lore] discovered in Northgard will allow you to unlock Knowledge.
Lore.texts.plural.name: Lore

Faith.texts.name: Faith
Faith.texts.desc: [Faith] discovered in Northgard will allow you to unlock Knowledge.
Faith.texts.plural.name: Faith

Fame.texts.name: Fame
Fame.texts.desc: Increase your [Fame] and be proclaimed King of Northgard!
Fame.texts.plural.name: Fame

Blood.texts.name: Dragon Essence
Blood.texts.desc: Sacrifice enough units to gain [Blood] and earn the gods' favors. Don't, and face the consequences of this affront.
Blood.texts.plural.name: Dragon Essence

Prescience.texts.name: Wyrd
Prescience.texts.desc: Assign [Seeress]s to produce [Prescience] and curry the Kraken's favor.
Prescience.texts.plural.name: Wyrd

PopReserve.texts.name: Population's reserve
PopReserve.texts.desc: Once max population is reached, extra villagers wait in your [TownHall] and will appear as soon as there is room for them.
PopReserve.texts.plural.name: Population's reserve

SpecterWarriorPop.texts.name: Spectral Warrior
SpecterWarriorPop.texts.desc:
They will join your clan instead of villagers if you don't produce [Prescience].
Build [Horgr]s to increase the maximum number you can receive.
SpecterWarriorPop.texts.plural.name: Spectral Warriors

Stone.texts.name: Stone
Stone.texts.desc: [Stone] can be spent to upgrade your clan buildings.
Stone.texts.plural.name: Stone

Iron.texts.name: Iron
Iron.texts.desc: [Iron] is used to forge powerful weapons and craft better tools.
Iron.texts.plural.name: Iron

Prestige.texts.name: Commercial Influence
Prestige.texts.desc: [Prestige] can be earned by exploiting Great Trade Routes via a [Lighthouse].
Prestige.texts.plural.name: Commercial Influence

RimeSteel.texts.name: Rimesteel
RimeSteel.texts.desc: [RimeSteel] is used to forge the mighty Wurmslayer.
RimeSteel.texts.plural.name: Rimesteel

Gemstone.texts.name: Gemstone
Gemstone.texts.desc: [Gemstone] is a valuable resource coveted by [DwarfFaction]s and overseas merchants.
Gemstone.texts.plural.name: Gemstones

MilitaryXP.texts.name: Military Experience
MilitaryXP.texts.desc: You earn [MilitaryXP] by killing enemy units or losing your own in battle.
MilitaryXP.texts.plural.name: Military Experience

HuntTrophy.texts.name: Hunting Trophy
HuntTrophy.texts.desc: You earn [HuntTrophy]s by killing animals and their mythical counterparts.
HuntTrophy.texts.plural.name: Hunting Trophies

GrowthLore.texts.name: Growth Lore
GrowthLore.texts.desc: This type of [Lore] can only unlock growth related knowledges and is learned by harvesting [Wood] and [Food].
GrowthLore.texts.plural.name: Growth Lore

MilitaryLore.texts.name: Military Lore
MilitaryLore.texts.desc: This type of [Lore] can only unlock military related knowledges and is learned by retrieving [MilitaryXP].
MilitaryLore.texts.plural.name: Military Lore

WealthLore.texts.name: Wealth Lore
WealthLore.texts.desc: This type of [Lore] can only unlock wealth related knowledges and is learned by earning [Money] or mining [Stone] and [Iron].
WealthLore.texts.plural.name: Money Lore

Artifact.texts.name: Ancestral Equipment
Artifact.texts.desc: Send [OxHero] to reclaim [Artifact]s from [AncientBattleground]s, and they will make him even more powerful than he already is.
Artifact.texts.plural.name: Ancestral Equipments

Ingredients.texts.name: Ingredients
Ingredients.texts.desc: Gather different [Ingredients] from different zones and use [Stove]s to turn them into useful [Meal]s.
Ingredients.texts.plural.name: Ingredients

Relation.texts.name: Relations
Relation.texts.desc: You can improve your relation with different factions by trading with them.

AvailableHawks.texts.name: Hawks
AvailableHawks.texts.desc: Hawks will gather resources on Boneyards and assist your sentinels.

BigGame.texts.name: Meat
BigGame.texts.desc: Meat is a good source of protein and iron, harvested from big mammals such as deer and wild boars. As a secondary ingredient, it usually increases the meal's effects' duration by making it more filling.

FreshwaterFish.texts.name: Fish
FreshwaterFish.texts.desc: Fish is a source of protein and phoshorus harvested from both freshwater and saltwater specimens. As a secondary ingredient, its strong iodized flavor usually helps increase the meal's effects.

Vegetables.texts.name: Vegetables
Vegetables.texts.desc: "Vegetable" is an umbrella word which covers pretty much every edible vegetal organism, including roots, and which are usually not consumed primarily for their sweetness. It is a useful side dish, served along meat or fish.

Mushrooms.texts.name: Mushrooms
Mushrooms.texts.desc: "Mushroom" refers to any type of fungus that was found to be edible through painful-to-lethal trial and error. They are easy to find in most forests and make for a healthy side dish, along with meat or fish.

Military.texts.title: Domination
Military.texts.desc: Develop your military and destroy your rivals' <font color="#R">Town Halls</font> to achieve supremacy.

Fame.texts.title: Fame
Fame.texts.desc: Expand your [Territory], carry out achievements and amass [Fame] to reach <font color="#R">greatness</font>.

Money.texts.title: Trade
Money.texts.desc: Focus on economy, develop a superior maritime trade and become the <font color="#R">most prosperous merchant</font> on Northgard.

Lore.texts.title: Wisdom
Lore.texts.desc: Study the land's [Lore] to uncover secrets from the past and obtain <font color="#R">the gods' blessings</font>.

Yggdrasil.texts.title: Yggdrasil
Yggdrasil.texts.desc: Find the legendary World Tree, <font color="#R">Yggdrasil</font>, and be the first to conquer it.

Helheim.texts.title: Helheim
Helheim.texts.desc: Take control of the <font color="#R">Gates of Helheim</font> and defend the zone against the [Valkyrie]s.

OdinSword.texts.title: Sword of Odin
OdinSword.texts.desc: Colonize the Anvil of Gods and forge Odin's legendary sword using [Iron].

BestFame.texts.title: Glory
BestFame.texts.desc: Be the most famous when reaching ::date::.

LoreSword.texts.title: Gods' Wisdom
LoreSword.texts.desc: Become the wisest warchief. Achieve an Epic Lore Victory by deserving the 4 Blessings and controlling the [BigSword].

DefendJotnar.texts.title: [GiantFaction]'s Friend
DefendJotnar.texts.defeat: All the [GiantFaction]s camps have been eradicated.

DefendAIAlly.texts.title: Protect meek
DefendAIAlly.texts.desc: Protect your weak ally from enemies at any price.

KillColossalBoar.texts.title: Epic Trophy
KillColossalBoar.texts.desc: Be the first to find and kill the [ColossalBoar].

HelheimControl.texts.title: Helheim Invasion
HelheimControl.texts.desc: Control all [Helheim]s to block the invasion.
HelheimControl.texts.defeat: You failed to stop the invasion.

FameAlt.texts.title: Fame
FameAlt.texts.desc: Raise your [Fame] to obtain the title of <font color="#R">King</font>.

KillWarg.texts.title: Apex Predator
KillWarg.texts.desc: A warg is hiding somewhere. Find it and kill it to prove your hunting skills.

DeathMatch.texts.title: Last One Standing
DeathMatch.texts.desc: Kill the other warchiefs and keep yours alive.
DeathMatch.texts.defeat: Your warchief has been killed too many times.

FootholdGoat.texts.defeat: Halvard and the Heidrun Clan have met their end.

TimeOver.texts.defeat: You have reached the time limit.

BabyWyvernDen.texts.defeat: You failed to protect the egg.

AnyBasic.texts.title: Common victories
AnyBasic.texts.desc: You can achieve any victory: Domination, Fame, Trading or Wisdom.

Map.texts.title: Map Special
Map.texts.desc: With each new game, a different mythical place will emerge at the heart of Northgard. Harness its power to become a legend.

GiantFaction.texts.name: Jötunn
GiantFaction.texts.unitDesc: Ancient creatures from the Dark Ages, [GiantFaction]s are peaceful until you attack them. If you do, brace yourself!
GiantFaction.texts.placeDesc: [GiantFaction]s are usually peaceful... Trade enough [Food] with them and they might join you.
GiantFaction.texts.plural.name: Jötnar

line0.name: Frequent attacks
line0.desc: [GiantFaction]s attack you on a regular basis.

line1.name: Peace, but no trespassing
line1.desc: [GiantFaction]s are peaceful and won't attack, but you may not trespass.

line2.name: Freeroaming allowed
line2.desc: You can move freely across the [GiantFaction]s' territory.

line3.name: Battle ally
line3.desc: You gain ::res_list::. [GiantFaction]s give you one of their strongest champions. They are loyal to a single clan.

KoboldFaction.texts.name: Kobold
KoboldFaction.texts.unitDesc: [KoboldFaction]s can be a great trade partner, but also an annoyance when they take valuable land.
KoboldFaction.texts.placeDesc: [KoboldFaction]s will spawn here and spread to nearby territories.
KoboldFaction.texts.plural.name: Kobolds
KoboldFaction.franceTexts.name: Farfadet
KoboldFaction.franceTexts.unitDesc: Mischievous and dismal, the [KoboldFaction] lurk in the shadows and play tricks on those who manage to see them.
KoboldFaction.franceTexts.placeDesc: In [KoboldFaction] language, there is no word for hygiene. There is one for order, tough. It's pronounced "chaos".

line0.name: Prioritary attacks
line0.desc: You are a main target for the [KoboldFaction]s and they attack more aggressively.

line1.name: Attacks for expansion
line1.desc: [KoboldFaction]s actively attack you to expand their territory.

line2.name: Peace, freeroaming allowed
line2.desc: You can move freely across the [KoboldFaction]s' territory. They will no longer attack you.

line3.name: Trading partner
line3.desc:
You gain ::res_list::. Unlock one trade route to their Kingdom with +::value1:: [Money]. This value is divided among the clans they befriended.
You can colonize [KoboldFaction]s' additional territories in exchange for [Money].

MyrkalfarFaction.texts.name: Myrkálf
MyrkalfarFaction.texts.unitDesc: The [MyrkalfarFaction]s are an agressive and cunning native faction. Never trust them, and watch their moves carefully. Don't let them enter your territory, otherwise they will steal resources from you.
MyrkalfarFaction.texts.placeDesc: The dwelling of the [MyrkalfarFaction]s is also their base of operations. Destroying it might be the only way to stop them. Don't let them enter your territory, they're a gang of thieves...
MyrkalfarFaction.texts.plural.name: Myrkálfar
MyrkalfarFaction.franceTexts.name: Elbe of Alberich
MyrkalfarFaction.franceTexts.unitDesc: Taller cousins of the [DwarfFaction]s, the [MyrkalfFaction] share their king Alberich with many outlandish creatures.
MyrkalfarFaction.franceTexts.placeDesc: No living human has ever seen the inside of these elegant house... nor has anyone ever wished to.

line0.name: Relentless raids
line0.desc: [MyrkalfarFaction]s attack you in priority and steal lots of [Food], [Wood] and [Money] each time.

line1.name: Occasional raids
line1.desc: [MyrkalfarFaction]s attack you and steal some [Food], [Wood] and [Money] each time.

line2.name: Peace, but no trespassing
line2.desc: [MyrkalfarFaction]s won't attack you.

line3.name: Raids target your enemies
line3.desc:
You gain ::res_list::. [MyrkalfarFaction]s will mainly target clans you are hostile to or at war with.
They are loyal to a single clan.

DwarfFaction.texts.name: Dwarf
DwarfFaction.texts.unitDesc: [DwarfFaction]s are industrious creatures that prefer to dwell in caves and mine shafts. Let them mine their heart out, and they will keep to themselves.
DwarfFaction.texts.placeDesc: [DwarfFaction]s use these old mine shafts as dwellings.
DwarfFaction.texts.plural.name: Dwarves
DwarfFaction.franceTexts.name: Gnome
DwarfFaction.franceTexts.unitDesc: Neustrian parents of the dwarves, the [DwarfFaction] only distinguish themselves by their characteristic scent.
DwarfFaction.franceTexts.placeDesc: [DwarfFaction]s extract riches from the ground, but they also hide their riches into the ground. There is no point.

line0.name: Frequent attacks
line0.desc:
[DwarfFaction]s attack you on a regular basis.
Colonizing zones near their camp will damage your relation.

line1.name: Peace, but no trespassing
line1.desc: [DwarfFaction]s are peaceful and no longer attack. Colonizing zones near their camp will damage your relation.

line2.name: Gifts
line2.desc:
[DwarfFaction]s will be giving you +::value1:: [Stone] or +::value2:: [Iron] for as long as their stocks last.
::stocks::.

line3.name: Mining allies
line3.desc: You gain ::res_list::. [DwarfFaction]s dispatch two of their most expert craftsmen to help you mine and forge.

GayantFaction.texts.name: Gayant
GayantFaction.texts.unitDesc: A secretive tribe of unknown origin, the [GayantFaction] are the guardians of the ancient beliefs.
GayantFaction.texts.placeDesc: Despite their refined garments and culture, the Gayants follow the old ways when it comes to housing.
GayantFaction.texts.plural.name: Gayants

line0.name: Frequent attacks
line0.desc: [GayantFaction]s attack you on a regular basis.

line1.name: Peace, but no trespassing
line1.desc: [GayantFaction]s are peaceful and won't attack, but you may not trespass.

line2.name: Freeroaming allowed
line2.desc: You can move freely across the [GayantFaction]s' territory.

line3.name: Battle ally
line3.desc: You gain ::res_list::. [GayantFaction]s give you one of their strongest champions. They are loyal to a single clan.

MarmennillFaction.texts.name: Marmennill
MarmennillFaction.texts.unitDesc: Long thought to be extinct, [MarmennillFaction]s rarely come to the surface to bargain with other races, and even then, they keep their distance.
MarmennillFaction.texts.placeDesc: [MarmennillFaction]s regroup in this seclusive cove, rich in sharp reefs when they want to meet with the people of the surface.
MarmennillFaction.texts.plural.name: Marmennills

line0.name: Indifference
line0.desc: [Marmennill]s are peacefull in their cove.

line1.name: Stranded gifts
line1.desc: Your workers' production is increased by ::percent_value1:: on the shores.

line2.name: A share of the spoils
line2.desc: You receive ::percent_value2:: of the specialized production from enemy shores.

Woodcutter.texts.name: Woodcutter
Woodcutter.texts.desc: Specialized in harvesting [Wood], Woodcutters are necessary to improve your clan's settlement.
Woodcutter.texts.plural.name: Woodcutters

Farmer.texts.name: Farmer
Farmer.texts.desc: Experienced in growing crops, Farmers produce [Food] in larger quantities during summer.
Farmer.texts.plural.name: Farmers

Hunter.texts.name: Hunter
Hunter.texts.desc: Skilled Hunters will track and kill deer to provide [Meat] for your clan.
Hunter.texts.plural.name: Hunters

Fisherman.texts.name: Fisherman
Fisherman.texts.desc: Fishermen provide fresh [Fish] for your clan. Their production is not affected by winter.
Fisherman.texts.plural.name: Fishermen

Merchant.texts.name: Merchant
Merchant.texts.desc: Maintaining buildings and recruiting a Warband costs [Money]. Merchants generate steady income for your clan.
Merchant.texts.plural.name: Merchants

Sailor.texts.name: Sailor
Sailor.texts.desc: Sailors will raid nearby coasts and bring [Money] and [Fame] or [Lore] to your clan.
Sailor.texts.plural.name: Sailors
Sailor.props.noFameDesc: Sailors will raid nearby coasts and bring [Money] and [Lore] to your clan.

InnKeeper.texts.name: Brewer
InnKeeper.texts.desc: A good Brewer provides a steady supply of ale and improves your clan's [Happy].
InnKeeper.texts.plural.name: Brewers

Miner.texts.name: Miner
Miner.texts.desc: Miners extract [Stone], [Iron], [RimeSteel] or [Gemstone] ores from the zone until the deposits are depleted.
Miner.texts.plural.name: Miners

Scout.texts.name: Scout
Scout.texts.desc:
Scouts explore new zones, allowing you to expand your territory. They can also explore Ruins and Shipwrecks.
They can spy an enemy's [TownHall] to see their resources.
Scout.texts.plural.name: Scouts

Falconer.texts.name: Falconer
Falconer.texts.desc:
[Falconer]s can't get hurt when exploring uncharted lands and reveal [Treasure]s over time.
They can open [Ruins] and [BrokenShores], as well as seal [WolvesCave]s or [DeathCamp]s even outside their territory.
Falconer.texts.flavor: I ain't no warrior, but I can throw a falcon punch.
Falconer.texts.plural.name: Falconers

Healer.texts.name: Healer
Healer.texts.desc: Healers gather medicinal herbs that your wounded will use to heal themselves. The wounded must be within your territory to heal. They also gather [Food] when not otherwise busy.
Healer.texts.plural.name: Healers

Smith.texts.name: Smith
Smith.texts.desc: Smiths can forge improved tools or weapons, powerful relics and the legendary Sword of Odin.
Smith.texts.plural.name: Smiths

Scholar.texts.name: Herald
Scholar.texts.desc: Heralds study politics, legends, and epic stories. They also like to alter a lot of it.
Scholar.texts.plural.name: Heralds

Emissary.texts.name: Emissary
Emissary.texts.desc: The Emissary is a diplomat appointed to handle rivalries in a proper way.
Emissary.texts.flavor: Look around. There are no enemies here. There's just a good, old-fashioned rivalry.
Emissary.texts.plural.name: Emissaries

DwarfChampion.texts.name: Dwarven Operative
DwarfChampion.texts.desc: [DwarfChampion]s are units dispatched by their corporations to perform mining and forging tasks where needed.
DwarfChampion.texts.flavor: Wait, that's how you hold a pickaxe? BWA HA HA!
DwarfChampion.texts.plural.name: Dwarven Operatives
DwarfChampion.franceTexts.name: Gnome Artisan
DwarfChampion.franceTexts.desc: A first-class [DwarfFaction] laborer chosen to help an allied clan.
DwarfChampion.franceTexts.plural.name: Gnome Artisans

Villager.texts.name: Villager
Villager.texts.desc: Villagers gather [Food] in the wild. Stock up so that your clan doesn't starve during winter.
Villager.texts.plural.name: Villagers

Slave.texts.name: Thrall
Slave.texts.desc:
[Slave]s do not count towards your population and do not require housing.
They also consume less [Food] and [Wood] and are less efficient when gathering resources.
Slave.texts.plural.name: Thralls

Seeress.texts.name: Seeress
Seeress.texts.desc: The Seeress try to elucidate the will of the Kraken, bringing foresight and good fortune to the clan.
Seeress.texts.plural.name: Seeresses

Mender.texts.name: Mender
Mender.texts.desc: Menders heal wounded Vikings within your territory and gather [Lore] when not otherwise busy. They tend to themselves with their gathering and thus don't require [Food].
Mender.texts.plural.name: Menders

Cook.texts.name: Cook
Cook.texts.desc: [Cook]s can prepare [Meal]s for your clan. They produce [Happy] and [Ingredients].
Cook.texts.plural.name: Cooks

Skald.texts.name: Skald
Skald.texts.desc: Skalds' tales of your clan's deeds will increase your [Fame] and [Happy].
Skald.texts.flavor: "Skald" literally means "poet." Skaldic poetry is one of the two main forms of Old Norse poetry, the other being Eddic poetry.
Skald.texts.plural.name: Skalds

RuneMaster.texts.name: Loremaster
RuneMaster.texts.desc: Masters of ancient [Lore], they can study runestones, unlocking Knowledge.
RuneMaster.texts.plural.name: Loremasters

Peon.texts.name: Subject
Peon.texts.desc: When not assigned to a specific task, subjects resort to prayer and cultivate [Faith].
Peon.texts.plural.name: Subjects

Woodcutter02.texts.name: Lumberjack
Woodcutter02.texts.desc: Lumberjacks collect the [Wood] needed to erect buildings and heat them.
Woodcutter02.texts.plural.name: Lumberjacks

Farmer02.texts.name: Peasant
Farmer02.texts.desc: Peasants harvest [Food]. Their crop is abundant in the summer but meager when winter comes.
Farmer02.texts.plural.name: Peasants

Hunter02.texts.name: Deerstalker
Hunter02.texts.desc: Deerstalkers hunt deer for [Meat] throughout the year, but their yields are slightly inferior in winter.
Hunter02.texts.plural.name: Deerstalkers

Fisherman02.texts.name: Angler
Fisherman02.texts.desc: Anglers catch [Fish] all year round. Their productivity is modest but steady.
Fisherman02.texts.plural.name: Anglers

Scout02.texts.name: Pathfinder
Scout02.texts.desc: Pathfinders can scout uncharted zones, explore Ruins or Shipwrecks and spy on enemy [TownHall]s to inform you on your rivals' resources.
Scout02.texts.plural.name: Pathfinders

InnKeeper02.texts.name: Taverner
InnKeeper02.texts.desc: Taverners bring [Happy] to the population by providing meeting places and recreation.
InnKeeper02.texts.plural.name: Taverners

Priest.texts.name: Monk
Priest.texts.desc: Monks produce [Faith] to acquire new knowledge. They also provide care to the wounded.
Priest.texts.plural.name: Monks

Merchant02.texts.name: Merchant
Merchant02.texts.desc: Maintaining buildings and recruiting a Warband costs [Money]. Merchants generate steady income for your clan.
Merchant02.texts.plural.name: Merchants

Sailor02.texts.name: Seafarer
Sailor02.texts.desc: Seafarers travel to distant lands from which they bring back abundant riches.
Sailor02.texts.plural.name: Seafarers

Warrior.texts.name: Warrior
Warrior.texts.desc: Warriors are strong units specialized in close combat.
Warrior.texts.flavor: Fun fact: Viking warriors did not wear horned helmets. This depiction originates from the 1876 rendition of Wagner's Der Ring des Nibelungen.
Warrior.texts.plural.name: Warriors

ShieldBearer.texts.name: Shield Bearer
ShieldBearer.texts.desc: Shield Bearers are a strong defensive unit that take less damage from projectiles.
ShieldBearer.texts.plural.name: Shield Bearers

AxeWielder.texts.name: Axe Thrower
AxeWielder.texts.desc: Axe Throwers are ranged units that are more powerful than the average warrior but a bit more fragile.
AxeWielder.texts.flavor: The trick is to give the ax a spinning motion when throwing it.
AxeWielder.texts.plural.name: Axe Throwers

Militia.texts.name: Militia
Militia.texts.desc: These armored civilians protect their territory but never venture outside of it.
Militia.texts.plural.name: Militias

Bodyguard.texts.name: Bodyguard
Bodyguard.texts.desc: A bodyguard is attached to your warchief.
Bodyguard.texts.flavor: You won't die before me, My Liege.
Bodyguard.texts.plural.name: Bodyguards

Tracker.texts.name: Tracker
Tracker.texts.desc: Trackers are ranged units that master deadly shooting styles, while not fighting in close combat.
Tracker.texts.plural.name: Trackers

FieldHealer.texts.name: Shaman
FieldHealer.texts.desc: When not fighting, Shamans will divide their heal amongst all nearby ally units. They can even heal outside of their territory, though less effeciently.
FieldHealer.texts.flavor: I will rest when the pyre is lit.
FieldHealer.texts.plural.name: Shamans

Einherjar.texts.name: Einherjar
Einherjar.texts.desc: [Einherjar]s are the most renowned [Warrior]s who the gods have chosen for the most glorious battles. Therefore, their base attack power increases as the clan gains more [Fame].
Einherjar.texts.plural.name: Einherjar

Skirmisher.texts.name: Skirmisher
Skirmisher.texts.desc:
Skirmishers are lightweight military units that trade offense and protection for mobility and [CanHide].
They can attack enemy zones but not decolonize them.
Skirmisher.texts.flavor: When you see them, it's probably too late.
Skirmisher.texts.plural.name: Skirmishers

Dragonmen.texts.name: Dragonkin
Dragonmen.texts.desc: Created through ancient sacrificial rites, the [Dragonmen]s will fight ferociously for all eternity.
Dragonmen.texts.plural.name: Dragonkin

Mercenary.texts.name: Mercenary
Mercenary.texts.desc: Hired for [Money], Mercenaries are not always reliable, but they'll wreak havoc on any territory they attack.
Mercenary.texts.plural.name: Mercenaries

MonsterDragonmen.texts.name: Draconic Nightmare
MonsterDragonmen.texts.desc: After several draconic rites, those warriors have lost every last bit of humanity in exchange for raw strength and power.
MonsterDragonmen.texts.plural.name: Draconic Nightmares

PeasantMilitia.texts.name: Sentry
PeasantMilitia.texts.desc: Sentries are basically [!Peon]s armed with pitchforks. They will try their best to protect their land, but they are untrained and insufficiently equipped.
PeasantMilitia.texts.plural.name: Sentries

Lord.texts.name: Lord
Lord.texts.desc: Lords are knights of noble descent who received authority over a fief. They will valiantly defend the zone surrounding their fort.
Lord.texts.plural.name: Lords

Overlord.texts.name: Leude
Overlord.texts.desc: Noblest of the lords, these powerful knights are bound to their sovereign by an oath of allegiance.
Overlord.texts.plural.name: Leudes

Bowman.texts.name: Archer
Bowman.texts.desc: Archers are vulnerable in close combat, but they can engage enemies at a distance with deathly arrows.
Bowman.texts.flavor: I still have my middle finger!
Bowman.texts.plural.name: Archers

Warrior02.texts.name: Champion
Warrior02.texts.desc: Champions attack slowly but they can strike two nearby units in a single blow.
Warrior02.texts.flavor: If all you have is a hammer, everything looks like a nail.
Warrior02.texts.plural.name: Champions

ShieldBearer02.texts.name: Fantassin
ShieldBearer02.texts.desc: Fantassins can only deal damage of medium severity, but their remarkable defense makes them more resistant.
ShieldBearer02.texts.flavor: He protec but he also attac
ShieldBearer02.texts.plural.name: Fantassins

Sentry.texts.name: Militia
Sentry.texts.desc: These armored civilians protect their territory but never venture outside of it.
Sentry.texts.plural.name: Militias

Bodyguard02.texts.name: Bodyguard
Bodyguard02.texts.desc: A bodyguard is attached to your warchief.
Bodyguard02.texts.flavor: You won't die before me, My Liege.
Bodyguard02.texts.plural.name: Bodyguards

Paladin.texts.name: Paladin
Paladin.texts.desc: Legendary knights and defenders of faith, Paladins can transport sacred Relics on the battleground.
Paladin.texts.flavor: Bringing the words of God to their rightful place: in your face!
Paladin.texts.plural.name: Paladins

Hero01.texts.name: Warchief
Hero01.texts.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.
Hero01.texts.plural.name: Warchiefs
Hero01.editor.name: Warchief [Goat]

Liv.texts.name: Liv
Liv.texts.desc: Ambitious and pragmatic, Liv, the cunning bannermaiden of the Raven Clan, likes to control every parameter of a situation and hates wasting time or Kröwns on futile pursuits.
Liv.texts.flavor: The end always justifies the means.
Liv.editor.name: Warchief [Raven]

Hero02.texts.name: Warchief
Hero02.texts.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.
Hero02.texts.plural.name: Warchiefs
Hero02.editor.name: Warchief [Raven]

Hero03.texts.name: Warchief
Hero03.texts.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.
Hero03.texts.plural.name: Warchiefs
Hero03.editor.name: Warchief [Stag]
