Hero04.texts.name: Warchief
Hero04.texts.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.
Hero04.texts.plural.name: Warchiefs
Hero04.editor.name: Warchief [Boar]

Berserker.texts.name: Berserker
Berserker.texts.desc: A powerful and reckless warrior, feared by all enemies of the Wolf Clan.
Berserker.texts.plural.name: Berserkers
Berserker.editor.name: Warchief [Wolf]

Maiden.texts.name: Skjaldmö
Maiden.texts.desc: Stalwart defender of her people, she is the reason the Bear Clan will never falter.
Maiden.texts.plural.name: Shield Maidens
Maiden.editor.name: Warchief [Bear]

WarchiefSnake.texts.name: Signy
WarchiefSnake.texts.desc: A shadowy leader with no regard for morals, Signy will stop at nothing to make a mark on Northgard.
WarchiefSnake.texts.flavor: The Snake will soon sink its fangs in Northgard!
WarchiefSnake.editor.name: Warchief [Snake]

WarchiefDragon.texts.name: Surtr
WarchiefDragon.texts.desc: Dreadful and draconian, Surtr used violence to take over the dragon's clan. One-armed bringer of doom, he appeared in the flames of Muspell and will not respite until they cover the land of the Aesir.
WarchiefDragon.texts.flavor: Only those who follow me will survive.
WarchiefDragon.editor.name: Warchief [Dragon]

HorseMaiden.texts.name: Eitria
HorseMaiden.texts.desc: A gifted artisan, Eitria focuses more on clan leadership and only picks up the pickaxe to let off steam.
HorseMaiden.texts.flavor: [HorseMaiden] is known for her carpentry skills.
HorseMaiden.editor.name: Warchief [Horse]

HorseHero.texts.name: Brok
HorseHero.texts.desc: Strong and wise, Brok is happy to focus on his craft and leave politics to his sister.
HorseHero.texts.flavor: [HorseHero] is known for his blacksmithing skills.
HorseHero.editor.name: Warchief [Horse]

Kara.texts.name: Kàra
Kara.texts.desc: Heir to the storm and carrying with her the wrath of the Ocean. Mistress in Valkyrie training.
Kara.texts.plural.name: Kàra
Kara.editor.name: Warchief [Kraken]

KrakenMaiden.texts.name: Warchief
KrakenMaiden.texts.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.
KrakenMaiden.texts.plural.name: Warchiefs
KrakenMaiden.editor.name: Warchief [Kraken]

OxHero.texts.name: Torfin
OxHero.texts.desc: Head of the clan of the Ox, [OxHero] is a Hero both feared and respected by all across Northgard.
OxHero.editor.name: Warchief [Ox]

LynxHero.texts.name: Mielikki
LynxHero.texts.desc: Fierce huntress in her youth, Mielikki is known as the Beastmaster. She now rules over Northgard's wildlife as she sees through [LynxBrown] and [LynxWhite]’s eyes.
LynxHero.texts.plural.name: Mielikkis
LynxHero.editor.name: Warchief [Lynx]

SquirrelHero.texts.name: Andhrímnir
SquirrelHero.texts.desc: Equally fearless in the kitchen and on the battlefield, Andhrímnir can be assigned to a [Stove] to produce [Ingredients] and prepare [Meal]s. Gains benefits from forging the [Cook] tool.
SquirrelHero.texts.flavor: So you're the "chicken" your clan keeps complaining about? Wait- you didn't know? Well, that's awkward...
SquirrelHero.texts.plural.name: Andhrímnirs
SquirrelHero.editor.name: Warchief [Squirrel]

RatMaiden.texts.name: Eir
RatMaiden.texts.desc: Deadly shaman and leader of the Rats, Eir uses her scythe to collect the healing herbs for her allies and to slay her enemies.
RatMaiden.texts.flavor: Stand still, and it might not be too painful...
RatMaiden.editor.name: Warchief [Rat]

EagleHero.texts.name: Grif
EagleHero.texts.desc: Orphaned by the extinction of their parents' clan, Grif were adopted at a young age by the followers of Hraesvelg. This demonstration of adaptability made them a perfect leader for this resilient clan.
EagleHero.texts.flavor: Stake your lives on this fight!
EagleHero.editor.name: Warchief [Eagle]

LionHero.texts.name: Hildegard
LionHero.texts.desc: Pious and heroic, Hildegard emerged from the shadows after a vision of Ragnarök came to her. Determined to drive back this unholy menace, she also intends to unify Neustria and put an end to her brothers' incessant feuds.
LionHero.editor.name: Warchief [Lion]

Hildegard.texts.name: Hildegard
Hildegard.texts.desc: Pious and heroic, Hildegard emerged from the shadows after a vision of Ragnarök came to her. Determined to drive back this unholy menace, she also intends to unify Neustria and put an end to her brothers' incessant feuds.
Hildegard.texts.flavor: Neustria shall bathe in sacred light again.
Hildegard.editor.name: Warchief [Hildegard]

Nominoe.texts.name: Nominoë
Nominoe.texts.desc: Strong-minded and popular, Nominoë leads the revolt of Kernev against Neustria. An adept of the region's semi-pagan spirituality, he's known as a selfless and down-to-earth leader.
Nominoe.texts.flavor: Let us free Kernev from the Neustrian yoke!
Nominoe.editor.name: Warchief [Nominoe]

Lothaire.texts.name: Lothaire
Lothaire.texts.desc: Cunning and shrewd, Lothaire is the former king of Neustria. The poor reputation of this unjust lord made him vulnerable to his brother's betrayal, but his influence has not lessened and his ambitions remain unwavering.
Lothaire.texts.flavor: I am not seeking retaliation. I am restoring order.
Lothaire.editor.name: Warchief [Lothaire]

Carloman.texts.name: Carloman
Carloman.texts.desc: Regal and authoritarian, Carloman became the new king of Neustria after overthrowing his own brother, Lothaire. But his lack of discernment has become a growing concern for his former allies.
Carloman.texts.flavor: Where there is no authority, there is no peace.
Carloman.editor.name: Warchief [Carloman]

Berserker03.texts.name: Egil
Berserker03.texts.desc: A ruthless and impetuous young berserker, Egil, bannerman of the Wolf Clan, is in it mostly for the mayhem.
Berserker03.editor.name: Bannerman [Wolf]

Maiden02.texts.name: Borgild
Maiden02.texts.desc: Brave and arrogant, Borgild, bannermaiden of the Bear Clan, is a tough woman who bows to no one and shows little mercy for the weakhearted.
Maiden02.editor.name: Bannerman [Bear]

Maiden03.texts.name: Liv
Maiden03.texts.desc: Ambitious and pragmatic, Liv, the cunning bannermaiden of the Raven Clan, likes to control every parameter of a situation and hates wasting time or Kröwns on futile pursuits.
Maiden03.texts.flavor: The end always justifies the means.
Maiden03.editor.name: Bannerman [Raven]

Hero06.texts.name: Halvard
Hero06.texts.desc: Halvard, the elderly bannerman of the Goat Clan, is a wise and kind-hearted man focused on the survival of his people.
Hero06.editor.name: Bannerman [Goat]

Hero07.texts.name: Brand
Hero07.texts.desc: Proud and noble at heart, Brand, bannerman of the Stag Clan, is a loyal man who lives and fights with honor.
Hero07.texts.flavor: May our victories be sung for centuries!
Hero07.editor.name: Bannerman [Stag]

Hero08.texts.name: Svarn
Hero08.texts.desc: The taciturn Svarn, spiritual leader of the Boar Clan rebels, is both a sage and a warrior who lives a simple life, close to Nature and in accordance with the Old Ways.
Hero08.texts.flavor: I can... FEEL your presence. Yes... YOURS.
Hero08.editor.name: Bannerman [Boar]

Surtr.texts.name: Surtr
Surtr.texts.desc: Dreadful and draconian, Surtr used violence to take over the dragon's clan. One-armed bringer of doom, he appeared in the flames of Muspell and will not respite until they cover the land of the Aesir.
Surtr.texts.flavor: Only those who follow me will survive.
Surtr.editor.name: Campaign Final Warchief

OldDragon.texts.name: Warchief
OldDragon.texts.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.
OldDragon.texts.plural.name: Warchief s
OldDragon.editor.name: Campaign Final Warchief

NornArmor.texts.name: Valkyrie
NornArmor.texts.desc: Wielding divine power, the Valkyries are the most powerful members of the Kraken's army.
NornArmor.texts.plural.name: Valkyries

GiantHero.texts.name: Jötunn Champion
GiantHero.texts.desc: [GiantHero] is a legendary [GiantFaction] who decided to befriend humans and lend them his unrivaled strength.
GiantHero.texts.plural.name: Jötunn Champions

GayantHero.texts.name: Gayant Champion
GayantHero.texts.desc: A first-class [GiantFaction] warrior chosen to help an allied clan or kingdom.
GayantHero.texts.flavor: I like my opponents the way I like my menhirs: in bunches.
GayantHero.texts.plural.name: Gayant Champions

Hero05.texts.name: Hagen
Hero05.texts.desc: The shady leader of the Raven Clan and murderer of your father. Although fierce and merciless, he tends to act cowardly when things turn sour.
Hero05.texts.flavor: Fight for me and ye'll be rich!
Hero05.editor.name: Campaign Warchief

Hero09.texts.name: Rig
Hero09.texts.desc: Noble but disgraced, Rig is the fallen king of Northgard. After unifying the Norse clans to fuel his personal vengeance, he failed to ward off Ragnarök and watched his authority crumble. Now, he wants to regain his honor and rebuild his kingdom.
Hero09.editor.name: Campaign Hero

Berserker02.texts.name: Hvedrung
Berserker02.texts.desc: The mysterious leader of the Boar Clan, hellbent on bringing about Ragnarök. His actions were somehow foretold by the Runes. Some believe he is not a mere mortal.
Berserker02.texts.flavor: I shall be "the villain" if it makes things more comprehensible for your feeble mind. And yes: I know you are reading this.
Berserker02.editor.name: Campaign Final Warchief

LichKing.texts.name: Valdemar The Cursed
LichKing.texts.desc: Valdemar is a powerful undead warchief. He is invulnerable as long at least one [IceGolem] stands by his side.
LichKing.texts.flavor: Valdemar was a legendary king who died bringing battle to Helheim. Or so we thought...
LichKing.editor.name: Conquest Warchief

UndeadGiantDragon.texts.name: Draconic Jötunn
UndeadGiantDragon.texts.desc: Jötnar are not immune to draconic transformations, and the result is quite impressive.
UndeadGiantDragon.texts.flavor: Somehow a Jötunn managed to fit inside a [DragonmenCamp].
UndeadGiantDragon.texts.plural.name: Draconic Jötnar

Gelon.texts.name: Gelon
Gelon.texts.desc: Ruler of the Gayant faction of Scarpe, Gelon is also a spiritual leader well-versed in Neustria's ancient history and legends.
Gelon.texts.flavor: The time has come for the godly scheme to unfold.

Giant.texts.name: Savage Jötunn
Giant.texts.desc: Ancient creatures from the Dark Ages, [GiantFaction]s are peaceful until you attack them. If you do, brace yourself!
Giant.texts.flavor: Ymir, the primitive giant, is said to be the father of all giants and dwarves.
Giant.texts.plural.name: Savage Jötnar

Myrkalfar.texts.name: Outcast Myrkálf
Myrkalfar.texts.desc: [MyrkalfarFaction]s are otherworldly creatures originating from Svartalfheim. They are usually bandits and looters and do not mingle with humains.
Myrkalfar.texts.flavor: Myrkálfar claim they are related to the powerful dragons; but so far, nothing sustained this theory.
Myrkalfar.texts.plural.name: Outcast Myrkálfar
Myrkalfar.franceTexts.name: Elbe Autochthon
Myrkalfar.franceTexts.desc: Taller cousins of the [DwarfFaction]s, the [MyrkalfFaction] share their king Alberich with many outlandish creatures.
Myrkalfar.franceTexts.plural.name: Elbe Autochthons

Kobold.texts.name: Vagrant Kobold
Kobold.texts.desc: [KoboldFaction]s can be a great trade partner, but also an annoyance when they take valuable land.
Kobold.texts.plural.name: Vagrant Kobolds
Kobold.franceTexts.name: Facetious Farfadet
Kobold.franceTexts.desc: Mischievous and dismal, the [KoboldFaction] lurk in the shadows and play tricks on those who manage to see them.
Kobold.franceTexts.plural.name: Facetious Farfadet

Dwarf.texts.name: Freelance Dwarf
Dwarf.texts.desc: [DwarfFactions]s are there to mine and forge!
Dwarf.texts.plural.name: Freelance Dwarves
Dwarf.franceTexts.name: Gnome Laborer
Dwarf.franceTexts.desc: Neustrian cousins of the dwarves, the [DwarfFaction] only distinguish themselves by their characteristic smell.
Dwarf.franceTexts.plural.name: Gnome Laborers

Gayant.texts.name: Gayant Hermit
Gayant.texts.desc: A secretive tribe of unknown origin, the [GayantFaction] are the guardians of the ancient cults.
Gayant.texts.plural.name: Gayant Hermit

Death.texts.name: Draugr
Death.texts.desc: Draugar are half-dead evil creatures that have infested the islands of Northgard.
Death.texts.flavor: Only the most nefarious and greediest human beings turn into Draugar when they die.
Death.texts.plural.name: Draugar
Death.franceTexts.name: Démon
Death.franceTexts.desc: These tormented souls have turned their backs on their god.
Death.franceTexts.plural.name: Démons

UndeadGiant.texts.name: Draugr Jötunn
UndeadGiant.texts.desc: Jötnar aren't immune to becoming Draugar.
UndeadGiant.texts.flavor: Your undead problems are now available in extra-large.
UndeadGiant.texts.plural.name: Draugr Jötnar

GiantFire.texts.name: Eldthurs
GiantFire.texts.desc: The "sons of Muspell" are hellbent on destroying the world. They will wreak as much havoc as they can before burning away, as they can't survive outside of their homeworld.
GiantFire.texts.plural.name: Eldthursar

GiantCrow.texts.name: Son of Hrymr
GiantCrow.texts.desc: They sometimes attack with their two huge warhammers, damaging all nearby enemies.
GiantCrow.texts.flavor: Chosing the smallest giants as mercenaries is important if you want your ships to stay afloat.
GiantCrow.texts.plural.name: Son of Hrymrs

Wolf.texts.name: Wolf
Wolf.texts.desc: Vicious giant wolves roam the lands of Northgard. They will not hesitate to attack humans.
Wolf.texts.plural.name: Wolves

WhiteWolf.texts.name: White Wolf
WhiteWolf.texts.desc: White wolves are more powerful than standard wolves.
WhiteWolf.texts.flavor: Avatars of the Wargs, they look for pieces of the sun and the moon lost in the world.
WhiteWolf.texts.plural.name: White Wolves

SacredWolf.texts.name: Mythical Wolf
SacredWolf.texts.desc: Mythical Wolves are the most dangerous of their kind.
SacredWolf.texts.plural.name: Mythical Wolves

SpectralWolf.texts.name: Wolf Spirit
SpectralWolf.texts.desc: The spirit of a Mythical Wolf comes back to unleash its rage one more time.
SpectralWolf.texts.plural.name: Wolves Spirit

Warg.texts.name: Warg
Warg.texts.desc: Closely related to Fenrir, this beast will be a tough fight compared to your standard wolves.
Warg.texts.plural.name: Wargs

Bear.texts.name: Brown Bear
Bear.texts.desc: Solitary creatures that fiercely defend their territory. They'll prove challenging to even the most seasoned warriors.
Bear.texts.plural.name: Brown Bears

WhiteBear.texts.name: Bear
WhiteBear.texts.desc: Solitary creatures that fiercely defend their territory. They'll prove challenging to even the most seasoned warriors.
WhiteBear.texts.plural.name: Bears

SacredBear.texts.name: Mythical Bear
SacredBear.texts.desc: Mythical Bears' massive paws will make the earth tremble in their path.
SacredBear.texts.plural.name: Mythical Bears

SpectralBear.texts.name: Bear Spirit
SpectralBear.texts.desc: The spirit of a Mythical Bear comes back to unleash its rage one more time.
SpectralBear.texts.plural.name: Bear Spirits

BearMaiden.texts.name: Kaija, the Armored Bear
BearMaiden.texts.desc: Kaija is a powerful defensive unit that cannot enter enemy territory, unless you have unlocked [BearAwake].
BearMaiden.texts.plural.name: Kaija, the Armored Bears

SacredRam.texts.name: Mythical Ram
SacredRam.texts.desc: Fathers of Northgard sheeps, Mythical Rams will protect them at all cost.
SacredRam.texts.plural.name: Mythical Rams

SpectralRam.texts.name: Ram Spirit
SpectralRam.texts.desc: The spirit of a Mythical Ram comes back to unleash its rage one more time.
SpectralRam.texts.plural.name: Ram Spirits

LynxBrown.texts.name: Brundr
LynxBrown.texts.desc: [LynxBrown] is the youngest, playful brother. He may look like an innocent cat, but his scratches are no joke.

LynxWhite.texts.name: Kaelinn
LynxWhite.texts.desc: [LynxWhite] seeks to protect his young brother from Northgard's cruel foes. They fear his roar across all lands.
LynxWhite.texts.flavor: Is that a firefly, in the bush? Aaargh!

BabyWyvern.texts.name: Young Wyvern
BabyWyvern.texts.desc: This young wyvern got lost, but hopefully, you found it. Unfortunately for your enemies though, they will probably try to kill it.
BabyWyvern.texts.flavor: Well, this one definitely has teeth judging by the screams of its enemies.
BabyWyvern.texts.plural.name: Baby Wyverns

Wyvern.texts.name: Wyvern
Wyvern.texts.desc: The most fearsome of the ancient creatures roaming the lands of Northgard.
Wyvern.texts.plural.name: Wyverns
Wyvern.franceTexts.name: Vouivre
Wyvern.franceTexts.plural.name: Vouivres

WyvernUndead.texts.name: Undead Wyvern
WyvernUndead.texts.desc: The most fearsome of the ancient creatures roaming the lands of Northgard.
WyvernUndead.texts.plural.name: Undead Wyverns

Valkyrie.texts.name: Fallen Valkyrie
Valkyrie.texts.desc: Originally champions of the gods, some Valkyries have been corrupted by the powers of Helheim.
Valkyrie.texts.flavor: "Valkyrie" means "chooser of the slain," as they decide which fallen warriors will join Odin in Valhöll.
Valkyrie.texts.plural.name: Fallen Valkyrie

SpecterWarrior.texts.name: Spectral Warrior
SpecterWarrior.texts.desc: These undead Vikings are dangerous foes whose mere presence within your borders will reduce your clan's [Happy]. Projectiles have ::percent_value:: chances of missing them.
SpecterWarrior.texts.flavor: An intricate Seidr burial ritual can bring back the soul of a warrior who didn't die in battle, so that they can fight for glory one last time and find peace.
SpecterWarrior.texts.plural.name: Spectral Warriors
SpecterWarrior.franceTexts.name: Anaon
SpecterWarrior.franceTexts.plural.name: Anaons

IceWorm.texts.name: Hrímgandr
IceWorm.texts.desc: A giant, near-invincible rime serpent living mostly underground. Only the Wurmslayer can make a dent in its diamond-hard icy scales.
IceWorm.texts.flavor: Said to be the spawn of Jörmungandr, imbued with Niflheim's fumes.
IceWorm.texts.plural.name: Hrímgandar

Golem.texts.name: Rock Golem
Golem.texts.desc: [Golem]s are powerful creatures that can burn their foes with molten lava.
Golem.texts.plural.name: Rock Golems

IceGolem.texts.name: Dark Vaettir
IceGolem.texts.desc: Unholy ice spirits that should not live on this side of Bifrost.
IceGolem.texts.plural.name: Dark Vaettirs

GiantBoar.texts.name: Giant Boar
GiantBoar.texts.desc: It can be sacrificed to gain 200 [Food] and it defends your territory. Outside of combat, you can control it.
GiantBoar.texts.flavor: A formidable beast with the ability to mend its own wounds, magical in nature, Gullinbursti was created by legendary dwarven craftsmen, the Sons of Ivaldi.
GiantBoar.texts.plural.name: Giant Boars

ColossalBoar.texts.name: Colossal Boar
ColossalBoar.texts.desc: This majestic creature is the ideal hunting trophy to bring back home. Its health still regenerates quickly.
ColossalBoar.texts.flavor: A formidable beast with the ability to mend its own wounds, magical in nature, Gullinbursti was created by legendary dwarven craftsmen, the Sons of Ivaldi.
ColossalBoar.texts.plural.name: Colossal Boars

Spider.texts.name: Spider
Spider.texts.desc: Oversized eight-legged creatures with a strong will to defend their territory. They'll prove challenging to even the most seasoned warriors.
Spider.texts.flavor: Yes, we have an Arachnophobia Mode. Check the Options!
Spider.texts.plural.name: Spiders

RevivedCarcass.texts.name: Garm's Incarnation
RevivedCarcass.texts.desc:
Brought back to life by a flame of Muspelheim, it will relentlessly hunt for new victims as long as the Pyre is ignited.
But once extinguished, the corpses will slowly go back to their original form and expire.
RevivedCarcass.texts.flavor: It has the eyes of Aaron, the smile of Bothild, and the spirit of Mikeld.
RevivedCarcass.texts.plural.name: Garm's Incarnations

Tarasque.texts.name: Tarasque
Tarasque.texts.desc: The ferocious Tarasque will not let us extract the sword embedded in its back. And as it can regenerate health by eating stone deposits, our only chance of success is to find a way to stun it.

DwarfKing.texts.name: Warden of the Gate
DwarfKing.texts.desc: No matter how hard you knock, the warden will not let you pass. You'll have to go through him.

Fox.texts.name: Fox
Fox.texts.desc: Although foxes and wolves are related, they have evolved into very different species with different behaviors and strategies for survival.
Fox.texts.plural.name: Foxes

Sheep.texts.name: Sheep
Sheep.texts.desc: Having at least one Sheep in a zone reduces the need for Firewood by ::percent:: during winter for this zone.
Sheep.texts.flavor: Clicking this Sheep repeatedly is guaranteed to be 100% safe.
Sheep.texts.plural.name: Sheep

Vedrfolnir.texts.name: Vedrfolnir
Vedrfolnir.texts.desc: Vedrfolnir has been hurt. Once healed, it will scout certain zones for your clan. You will also gain 100 [Lore].
Vedrfolnir.texts.flavor: Vedrfolnir is a hawk usually sitting between the eyes of the giant eagle perched atop Yggdrasil.
Vedrfolnir.texts.plural.name: Vedrfolnirs

Hawk.texts.name: Hawk
Hawk.texts.desc: Hawks will gather resources on Boneyards and assist your sentinels.
Hawk.texts.flavor: Couldn't they have taken the ring into Mordor?!
Hawk.texts.plural.name: Hawks

Marmennill.texts.name: Tribal Marmennill
Marmennill.texts.desc: Seeing a Marmennill is a rare occurrence. Furthermore on land, they must be here for a reason.
Marmennill.texts.plural.name: Tribal Marmennills

BerserkerBoar.texts.name: Hvedrung
BerserkerBoar.texts.desc: The mysterious leader of the Boar Clan, hellbent on bringing about Ragnarök. His actions were somehow foretold by the Runes. Some believe he is not a mere mortal.
BerserkerBoar.texts.flavor: I shall be "the villain" if it makes things more comprehensible for your feeble mind. And yes: I know you are reading this.
BerserkerBoar.editor.name: Warchief [Boar]

Group.texts.name: Group
Group.texts.desc: Click to select a specific job among the group:
Group.texts.plural.name: Groups

HrimnirHero.texts.name: Champion of Hrímnir
HrimnirHero.texts.desc: [HrimnirHero] is a legendary [GiantFaction] who decided to befriend humans and lend them his unrivaled strength.

MogthrasirHero.texts.name: Champion of Mogthrasir
MogthrasirHero.texts.desc: [MogthrasirHero] is a legendary [GiantFaction] who decided to befriend humans and lend them his unrivaled strength.

OskrudrHero.texts.name: Champion of Öskrudr
OskrudrHero.texts.desc: [OskrudrHero] is a legendary [GiantFaction] who decided to befriend humans and lend them his unrivaled strength.

DurnirHero.texts.name: Champion of Dúrnir
DurnirHero.texts.desc: [DurnirHero] is a legendary [GiantFaction] who decided to befriend humans and lend them his unrivaled strength.

ScarpeHero.texts.name: Champion of Scarpe
ScarpeHero.texts.desc: A first-class [GiantFaction] warrior chosen to help an allied clan or kingdom.
ScarpeHero.texts.flavor: I like my opponents the way I like my menhirs: in bunches.
ScarpeHero.texts.plural.name: Champions of Scarpe

PeveleHero.texts.name: Champion of Pevele
PeveleHero.texts.desc: A first-class [GiantFaction] warrior chosen to help an allied clan or kingdom.
PeveleHero.texts.flavor: I like my opponents the way I like my menhirs: in bunches.
PeveleHero.texts.plural.name: Champions of Pevele

OstreventHero.texts.name: Champion of Ostrevent
OstreventHero.texts.desc: A first-class [GiantFaction] warrior chosen to help an allied clan or kingdom.
OstreventHero.texts.flavor: I like my opponents the way I like my menhirs: in bunches.
OstreventHero.texts.plural.name: Champions of Ostrevent

EscautHero.texts.name: Champion of Escaut
EscautHero.texts.desc: A first-class [GiantFaction] warrior chosen to help an allied clan or kingdom.
EscautHero.texts.flavor: I like my opponents the way I like my menhirs: in bunches.
EscautHero.texts.plural.name: Champions of Escaut

FakeSpider.texts.name: Not a Spider
FakeSpider.texts.desc: Definitely not your traditional eight-legged critter.
FakeSpider.texts.flavor: You can get the spiders back by going through the Options and unchecking the Arachnophobia Mode.
FakeSpider.texts.plural.name: Not a Spiders

ScoutCamp.texts.name: Scout Camp
ScoutCamp.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Scout]s who can explore new zones.
ScoutCamp.texts.flavor: Empty for the greater part of the year.
ScoutCamp.texts.plural.name: Scout Camps

line0.desc: Increases all your [Scout]s' scouting speed by ::percent::. They also can go to enemy territories.

House.texts.name: House
House.texts.desc: Provides shelter for more clan members.
House.texts.plural.name: Houses

line0.desc: Can shelter ::value:: additional clan members and improve housing quality.

HealerHut.texts.name: Healer's Hut
HealerHut.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Healer]s who will heal your wounded or sick clan members in your territory. They gather [Food] while not healing.
HealerHut.texts.plural.name: Healer's Huts

line0.desc: Heal your clan members ::percent:: faster.

Tavern.texts.name: Brewery
Tavern.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [InnKeeper]s who will increase your clan's [Happy].
Tavern.texts.plural.name: Breweries

WoodLodge.texts.name: Woodcutter's Lodge
WoodLodge.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Woodcutter]s who can harvest Wood in this zone.
WoodLodge.texts.plural.name: Woodcutter's Lodges

Fields.texts.name: Fields
Fields.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Farmer]s who will produce [Food] in larger quantities during summer.
Fields.texts.plural.name: Fields

HunterLodge.texts.name: Hunter's Lodge
HunterLodge.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Hunter]s who will track and kill deer.
HunterLodge.texts.plural.name: Hunter's Lodges

FishermanHouse.texts.name: Fisherman's Hut
FishermanHouse.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Fisherman]s who will produce [Food] even during winter.
FishermanHouse.texts.plural.name: Fisherman's Huts

FoodSilo.texts.name: Food Silo
FoodSilo.texts.desc: Improves [Food] produced by specialized workers in this zone by ::percent::. Increases your maximum food storage.
FoodSilo.texts.plural.name: Food Silos

line0.desc: Improves [Food] produced in this zone by ::percent::.

TradingPost.texts.name: Trading Post
TradingPost.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Merchant]s who will earn [Money]s.
TradingPost.texts.plural.name: Trading Posts

MarketPlace.texts.name: Marketplace
MarketPlace.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Merchant]s and spend [Money] to buy various resources.
MarketPlace.texts.plural.name: Marketplaces

Port.texts.name: Longship Dock
Port.texts.desc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] or [Fame] while raiding. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.
Port.texts.plural.name: Longship Docks
Port.props.noFameDesc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] while raiding. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.

AllMines.texts.name: Mine
AllMines.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Miner]s to extract [Stone], [Iron], [RimeSteel] or [Gemstone] ores from deposits.
AllMines.texts.plural.name: Mines

Forge.texts.name: Forge
Forge.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Smith]s. Allows you to forge better tools, weapons and legendary relics.
Forge.texts.plural.name: Forges

line0.desc: Increases forge speed by ::percent:: in the zone.

OfferingWell.texts.name: Offering Well
OfferingWell.texts.desc: Passively improves relationships with neutral factions in adjacent zones and makes them less aggressive towards you.
OfferingWell.texts.flavor: Everybody likes a gift every now and then!
OfferingWell.texts.plural.name: Offering Wells

Mine.texts.name: Mine
Mine.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Miner]s to extract [Stone], [Iron], [RimeSteel] or [Gemstone] ores from deposits.
Mine.texts.plural.name: Mines
Mine.editor.name: Mine

Stove.texts.name: Stove
Stove.texts.desc:
Allows the preparation of [Meal]s.
Assign your villagers to to become [Cook]s to gather ingredients and increase your [Happy].
[SquirrelHero] can also be assigned to it.
Add [StoveStorage] to your [Ingredients] max storage and an additional [UpgradedStoveStorage] if upgraded.
Stove.texts.plural.name: Stoves

line0.desc: [Cook]'s produce +::percent:: [Happy] and +::percent1:: [Ingredients]. Add an additional [UpgradedStoveStorage] max storage.

MenderHut.texts.name: Mender's Hut
MenderHut.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Mender]s who will heal your wounded clan members in your territory and gather [Lore] when not otherwise busy.
MenderHut.texts.plural.name: Mender's Huts

line0.desc: Heal your clan members ::percent:: faster.

ForgeHorse.texts.name: Völund's Forge
ForgeHorse.texts.desc: Allows you to forge better tools, weapons and legendary relics with your warchiefs.
ForgeHorse.texts.plural.name: Völund's Forges

line0.desc: Increases forge speed by ::percent:: in the zone.

CarvedStone.texts.name: Carved Stone
CarvedStone.texts.desc: Assign a villager to become a [RuneMaster] who will produce [Lore].
CarvedStone.texts.flavor: Quite a bit heavier than a book.
CarvedStone.texts.plural.name: Carved Stones
CarvedStone.franceTexts.name: Menhir
CarvedStone.franceTexts.desc: While norse clans can study these ancient stones, southern kingdoms will build religious edifices around them, stimulating [Faith] and [Money] production by ::percent1::.
CarvedStone.franceTexts.plural.name: Menhirs

Sheepfold.texts.name: Sheepfold
Sheepfold.texts.desc: Allows you to enclose your [Sheep]s to produce [Food]. The wood consumption effect of enclosed [Sheep]s is active all year long.
Sheepfold.texts.flavor: Better than slaughtering the poor things, right?
Sheepfold.texts.plural.name: Sheepfolds

line0.desc: Allows you to assign one more [Sheep]. They produce ::percent:: more [Food].

HallOfPoetry.texts.name: Hall of Skalds
HallOfPoetry.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Skald]s who will increase your clan's [Fame] and [Happy].
HallOfPoetry.texts.plural.name: Halls of Skalds

Horgr.texts.name: Hörgr
Horgr.texts.desc: Assign your female [VillagerWoman]s to become [Seeress]s. They will increase your clan's [Prescience].
Horgr.texts.plural.name: Hörgar

RavenPort.texts.name: Harbor
RavenPort.texts.desc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] or [Fame] while raiding. You can scout shores and hire [Mercenary]s. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.
RavenPort.texts.plural.name: Harbors

Fishery.texts.name: Fishing Cabin
Fishery.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become a [Fisherman]s who will produce [Food].
Fishery.texts.plural.name: Fishing Cabins

Falconry.texts.name: Aviary
Falconry.texts.desc:
Assign [Falconer]s to explore uncharted territories and reveal [Treasure]s over time.
[Falconry]s increase the maximum number of [Hawk]s sent on Boneyards.
Falconry.texts.plural.name: Falconries

line0.desc:
Unlocks an additional [Hawk].
Increases all your [Falconer]s' scouting and exploration speed by ::percent:: and allows them to enter enemy territory.

HouseCaro.texts.name: House
HouseCaro.texts.desc: Provides shelter for more clan members.
HouseCaro.texts.plural.name: Houses

line0.desc: Can shelter ::value:: additional clan members and improves [Comfort] in its zone.

ExplorerCamp.texts.name: Pathfinder Pavilion
ExplorerCamp.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Scout02]s, who scout uncharted zones and can explore Ruins or Shipwrecks.
ExplorerCamp.texts.flavor: Empty for the greater part of the year.
ExplorerCamp.texts.plural.name: Pathfinder Pavilions

line0.desc: Increases all your [Scout02]s' scouting speed by ::percent::. They also can go to enemy territories.

HappyPicker.texts.name: Tavern
HappyPicker.texts.desc: Increases [Comfort] in the zone and turns assigned subjects into [InnKeeper02]s, who improve [Happy].
HappyPicker.texts.plural.name: Taverns

CaroTavern.texts.name: Barroom
CaroTavern.texts.desc: [InnKeeper02]s assigned to this building improve [Happy] more efficiently. Increases [Comfort] in its zone.

Inn.texts.name: Hostelry
Inn.texts.shortDesc: Increased livability in all adjacent zones

FoodPicker.texts.name: Foraging Post
FoodPicker.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Farmer02]s, who provide [Food]. Also Increases your maximum food storage.
FoodPicker.texts.plural.name: Foraging Posts

YardFarm.texts.name: Farmstead
YardFarm.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Farmer02]s, who harvest [Food]. Their abundant summer yields compensate for their meager winter crop.
YardFarm.texts.plural.name: Farmsteads

Fisigard.texts.name: Fishery
Fisigard.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Fisherman02]s, who catch [Fish]. They maintain a modest but steady productivity throughout the year.
Fisigard.texts.plural.name: Fisheries

Buret.texts.name: Venery
Buret.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Hunter]s, who provide [Meat]. Their yields are slightly inferior in winter.
Buret.texts.plural.name: Veneries

WoodPicker.texts.name: Lumber Camp
WoodPicker.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Woodcutter02]s, who collect wood for heating and construction.
WoodPicker.texts.plural.name: Lumber Camps

LumberCamp.texts.name: Lumber Camp
LumberCamp.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Woodcutter02]s, who collect wood for heating and construction.
LumberCamp.texts.plural.name: Lumber Camps

KrownPicker.texts.name: Mart
KrownPicker.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Merchant]s, who amass [Money].
KrownPicker.texts.plural.name: Marts

TradeStore.texts.name: Fairground
TradeStore.texts.desc: Allows you to trade with other clans and factions, generating [Money] and improving your relationships.
TradeStore.texts.plural.name: Fairground

Market.texts.name: Retail Outlet
Market.texts.desc: Allows you to buy resources in exchange for [Money].
Market.texts.plural.name: Retail Outlets

CaroPort.texts.name: Anchorage
CaroPort.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Sailor02]s, who produce [Money].
CaroPort.texts.plural.name: Anchorages
CaroPort.props.noFameDesc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] while raiding. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.

MerchantPort.texts.name: Merchant Port
MerchantPort.texts.desc: [Sailor02]s assigned to this building produce [Money] more efficiently. Also gives access to Great Trade Routes.
MerchantPort.texts.plural.name: Merchant Ports
MerchantPort.texts.shortDesc: Access to Great Trade Routes & faster production.
MerchantPort.props.noFameDesc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] while raiding. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.

ExpeditionPort.texts.name: Seaport
ExpeditionPort.texts.desc: In addition to [Money], [Sailor02]s assigned to this building can bring back other resources from their expeditions.
ExpeditionPort.texts.plural.name: Seaports
ExpeditionPort.props.noFameDesc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] while raiding. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.

QuarryStone.texts.name: Quarry
QuarryStone.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Miner]s, can who extract [Stone], [Iron] or [Gemstone].
QuarryStone.texts.plural.name: Quarries
QuarryStone.editor.name: Mine

Smithy.texts.name: Smithy
Smithy.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Smith]s, who enhance production in the zone by ::percent:: without occupying a [Comfort] slot.
Smithy.texts.plural.name: Smithies

TrainingCamp.texts.name: Training Camp
TrainingCamp.texts.desc: Allows you to recruit [Warrior]s and increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
TrainingCamp.texts.plural.name: Training Camps

line0.desc: Increases your [Warrior]s' attack by ::percent_value1::. You also gain +::value::[Warband].

SkirmishCenter.texts.name: Skirmisher Camp
SkirmishCenter.texts.desc: Allows you to recruit [Skirmisher]s and increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
SkirmishCenter.texts.plural.name: Skirmisher Camps

line0.desc: Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [Skirmisher]s' attack by ::percent_value1::.

AxeCenter.texts.name: Axe Thrower Camp
AxeCenter.texts.desc: Allows you to recruit [AxeWielder]s, powerful ranged units, and increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
AxeCenter.texts.plural.name: Axe Thrower Camps

line0.desc: Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [AxeWielder]s' attack by ::percent_value1::.

ShieldCenter.texts.name: Shield Bearer Camp
ShieldCenter.texts.desc: Allows you to recruit [ShieldBearer]s, which are well protected against ranged units and towers, and increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
ShieldCenter.texts.plural.name: Shield Bearer Camps

line0.desc: Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [ShieldBearer]s' attack by ::percent_value1::.

GuardTower.texts.name: Watch Tower
GuardTower.texts.desc: Protects this zone from enemies and oversees adjacent zones. Also produces [MilitaryXP].
GuardTower.texts.plural.name: Watch Towers

line0.desc: Increases the tower's attack and resistance by ::percent::. The tower produces ::value2:: [MilitaryXP], and oversees more distant zones.

line1.desc: Increases the tower's attack and resistance by ::percent::. The tower produces ::value2:: [MilitaryXP], and oversees even more distant zones.

Totem.texts.name: Carved Statue
Totem.texts.desc: This carving displays your prowess to all Vikings of the land!
Totem.texts.plural.name: Carved Statues

Temple.texts.name: Altar of Kings
Temple.texts.desc:
The Altar of Kings provides +::value::[Food], +::value2::[Wood], +::value3::[Money], and +::value4::[Lore] for every ::value6::[Fame].
When built, you gain +::value5::[Fame] and +::value1::[Happy].
Temple.texts.plural.name: Altars of Kings
Temple.props.noFameDesc: The Altar of Kings provides +::value::$icon(Food) +::value2::$icon(Wood) +::value3::$icon(Money) +::value4::$icon(Lore) production as well as +::value1::$icon(Happy)

Lighthouse.texts.name: Lighthouse
Lighthouse.texts.desc: Allows you to create Great Routes. Must be built on a [Port]. This one is invulnerable to Kraken attack events.
Lighthouse.texts.plural.name: Lighthouses
Lighthouse.editor.name: Lighthouse (Longship Dock)

EmissaryLodge.texts.name: Emissary Lodge
EmissaryLodge.texts.desc: Trains an [Emissary] to establish and manage a [Rivalry].
EmissaryLodge.texts.plural.name: Emissary Lodges
EmissaryLodge.editor.name: Emissary Lodge

Lure.texts.name: Standard Lure
Lure.texts.desc: Attract deers to the zone. Assign your villagers to it to become [Hunter]s with a production bonus.
Lure.texts.plural.name: Standard Lures

AncientBattleground.texts.name: Ancient Battleground
AncientBattleground.texts.desc: A place where brave souls fell in the burning heat of battle. Send [OxHero] to excavate [Artifact] from here.
AncientBattleground.texts.flavor: Memories of terrible battles fade with time, but powerful remnants remain for those who deserve it.
AncientBattleground.texts.plural.name: Ancient Battlegrounds

LureSacred.texts.name: Mythical Lure
LureSacred.texts.desc:
Attracts mythical beasts coming in groups, hungry for some food.
Wave cleared: ::waves::.
LureSacred.texts.flavor: Make sure you don't end up being said food!
LureSacred.texts.plural.name: Mythical Lures

RavenLighthouse.texts.name: Lighthouse
RavenLighthouse.texts.desc: Allows you to create Great Routes. Must be built on a [RavenPort]. This one is invulnerable to Kraken attack events.
RavenLighthouse.texts.plural.name: Lighthouses
RavenLighthouse.editor.name: Lighthouse (Harbor)

SacrificialPyre.texts.name: Sacrificial Pyre
SacrificialPyre.texts.desc: Sacrifice your units to gain [Blood]. Sacrificed [Slave]s are worth more [Blood].
SacrificialPyre.texts.plural.name: Sacrificial Pyres

OxThrone.texts.name: Torfin's Throne
OxThrone.texts.desc:
This is the throne of the legendary [OxHero]. You will summon him for your clan.
Produces [Lore] when [OxHero] is not summoned.
OxThrone.texts.plural.name: Torfin's Thrones

WatchTower.texts.name: Defense Tower
WatchTower.texts.desc: Protects this zone from enemies by firing at them.
WatchTower.texts.plural.name: Defense Towers

line0.desc: Increases the tower's attack and resistance by ::percent::.

line1.desc: Increases the tower's attack and resistance by ::percent::.

Archery.texts.name: Archery Range
Archery.texts.desc: Allows you to recruit [Tracker]s and increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
Archery.texts.plural.name: Archery Ranges

line0.desc: Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [Tracker]s' attack by ::percent_value1::.

DragonmenCamp.texts.name: Dragonkin Altar
DragonmenCamp.texts.desc: Permanently transforms your villagers into [Dragonmen]s by following forgotten rituals and increases your [Warband]s size by ::value::.
DragonmenCamp.texts.plural.name: Dragonkin Altars

line0.desc: Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [Dragonmen]s' attack by ::percent_value1::.

HealerCamp.texts.name: Shaman Camp
HealerCamp.texts.desc:
Allows you to train [FieldHealer]s, providing both care to their allies and pain to their enemies.
Increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
HealerCamp.texts.plural.name: Shaman Camps

line0.desc:
Increases your [FieldHealer]s' health by ::percent_value1::.
You also gain +::value::[Warband]

CursedTreasure.texts.name: Forbidden Cache
CursedTreasure.texts.desc: When opened, the monsters contained in this cache will be released, and all your units in the zone will receive a +::percent_value2:: attack power bonus until they die (max ::percent_value3::).
CursedTreasure.texts.plural.name: Forbidden Caches

Outpost.texts.name: Sentry Camp
Outpost.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [PeasantMilitia]s, weak but uncostly military units. Increases your maximum [Warband] by 2.
Outpost.texts.plural.name: Sentry Camps

Fort.texts.name: Fort
Fort.texts.desc: Turns an assigned subject into a [Lord], who will guard this zone with bravery.
Fort.texts.plural.name: Forts

line0.desc: Your [Lord] will be able to go to a nearby zone.

WarriorCamp.texts.name: Champion Camp
WarriorCamp.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Warrior02]s, who can strike multiple units at once. Increases your maximum [Warband] by 3.
WarriorCamp.texts.plural.name: Champion Camps

line0.desc: Increases your [Warrior02]s' attack by ::percent_value1::. You also gain +::value:: [Warband].

ShieldCamp.texts.name: Fantassin Camp
ShieldCamp.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into defensive [ShieldBearer02]s. Increases your maximum [Warband] by 3.
ShieldCamp.texts.plural.name: Fantassin Camps

line0.desc: Increases your [ShieldBearer02]s' attack by ::percent_value1::. You also gain +::value:: [Warband].

ArcheryCamp.texts.name: Archery Camp
ArcheryCamp.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into long range [Bowman]s. Increases your maximum [Warband] by 3.
ArcheryCamp.texts.plural.name: Archery Camps

line0.desc: Increases your [Bowman]s' attack by ::percent_value1::. You also gain +::value:: [Warband].

Church.texts.name: Monastery
Church.texts.desc: Turns assigned subjects into [Monk]s, who cultivate [Faith] and heal wounded units.
Church.texts.plural.name: Monasteries

Basilica.texts.name: Abbey
Basilica.texts.desc:
Provides +::value::$icon(Food) +::value2::$icon(Wood) +::value3::$icon(Money) and +::value4::$icon(Faith) for every ::value5::$icon(Fame), as well as +::value1::$icon(Happy).
[Monk]s assigned to the Abbey also generate [Fame].
Basilica.texts.plural.name: Abbeys
Basilica.props.noFameDesc: The Basilica provides +::value::$icon(Food) +::value2::$icon(Wood) +::value3::$icon(Money) +::value4::$icon(Lore) production as well as +::value1::$icon(Happy)

Reliquary.texts.name: Reliquary
Reliquary.texts.desc: Assigned [Monk]s cultivate more [Faith] and can uncover relics.
Reliquary.texts.plural.name: Reliquaries

ResourceBag.texts.name: Loot Pouch
ResourceBag.texts.desc:
[Hawk]s gathered those resources from a boneyard.
Claim them for yourself or let an ally colonize the zone if you're feeling generous.
ResourceBag.texts.plural.name: Loot Pouches

Crate.texts.name: Crate
Crate.texts.desc: A simple crate, maybe with stuff inside.
Crate.franceTexts.name: Old Fishery's Gear
Crate.franceTexts.desc: This abandoned equipment once allowed the fishermen to feed Saint-Germain's population.

Perch.texts.name: Perch
Perch.texts.desc: A resting spot for your first [Hawk].

TownHall.texts.name: Town Hall
TownHall.texts.desc: Spawns new [Villager]s when you have enough [Happy].
TownHall.texts.plural.name: Town Halls

line0.desc: Allows you to upgrade other buildings. Increases maximum [Population] by ::value:: and population growth by ::percent1::.

CarolingianTownHall.texts.name: Chapel
CarolingianTownHall.texts.desc: Expands your population if [Happy] is high enough. Assigned subjects will recover their health.
CarolingianTownHall.texts.plural.name: Chapels

line0.desc: Allows you to upgrade other buildings. Increases maximum [Population] by ::value:: and population growth by ::percent1::.

line1.desc: Allows you to upgrade other buildings. Increases maximum [Warband] by ::value:: and population growth by ::percent1::.

CarolingianTownHallPop.texts.name: Cathedral
CarolingianTownHallPop.texts.desc: Increases your maximum population by 4 and the capacity of every house by 2. Expands your population if [Happy] is high enough.
CarolingianTownHallPop.texts.plural.name: Cathedrals

CarolingianTownHallMilitary.texts.name: Citadel
CarolingianTownHallMilitary.texts.desc: Increases your maximum warband by 2 and the capacity of every camp by 1. Expands your population if [Happy] is high enough.
CarolingianTownHallMilitary.texts.plural.name: Citadels

RuneStone.texts.name: Runestone
RuneStone.texts.desc: Assign a villager to become a [RuneMaster] who will produce [Lore].
RuneStone.texts.plural.name: Runestones
RuneStone.franceTexts.name: Menhir
RuneStone.franceTexts.desc: While norse clans can study these ancient stones, southern kingdoms will build religious edifices around them, stimulating [Faith] and [Money] production by ::percent1::.
RuneStone.franceTexts.plural.name: Menhirs
RuneStone.franceTexts.flavor: "Who? How? Why?", asks the erudite. "Stay out of the bowling alley", answers the giant.

CircleStone.texts.name: Circle of Stones
CircleStone.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [RuneMaster]s. All [!RuneMaster]s in this zone will produce ::percent:: more [Lore].
CircleStone.texts.plural.name: Circles of Stones
CircleStone.franceTexts.name: Carnac Stones
CircleStone.franceTexts.desc: While norse clans can study these ancient stones, southern kingdoms will build religious edifices around them, stimulating [Faith] and [Money] production by ::percent1::.
CircleStone.franceTexts.plural.name: Carnac Stones
CircleStone.franceTexts.flavor: Someone could have built castles and villages with these stones but chose to make this mess instead. How modern.

Fertility.texts.name: Fertile Land
Fertility.texts.desc: You can build [Fields] here and recruit [Farmer]s.
Fertility.texts.flavor: A little gift from Gefjon, the goddess of plowing.
Fertility.texts.plural.name: Fertile Lands
Fertility.franceTexts.flavor: It is unclear why this land gives better crops, but let us not ask too many questions.

Stones.texts.name: Stone Deposit
Stones.texts.desc: You can build a mine here to extract [Stone].
Stones.texts.plural.name: Stone Deposits

DeathCamp.texts.name: Draugr Tombs
DeathCamp.texts.desc: [Death]s will rise from this place until you take control of it.
DeathCamp.texts.plural.name: Draugr Tombs
DeathCamp.franceTexts.name: Ossuary
DeathCamp.franceTexts.plural.name: Ossuaries
DeathCamp.franceTexts.flavor: The remains abandoned here were never given proper care. The undead are unhappy.

Ruins.texts.name: Ruins
Ruins.texts.desc: Treasure is waiting to be found here, but only [::unit::]s will have the courage to venture within. Colonize first to explore.
Ruins.texts.plural.name: Ruins

IronDeposit.texts.name: Iron Deposit
IronDeposit.texts.desc: You can build an Iron Mine here to extract [Iron] ore.
IronDeposit.texts.plural.name: Iron Deposits

RimeSteelDeposit.texts.name: Rimesteel Deposit
RimeSteelDeposit.texts.desc: You can build a Mine here to extract [RimeSteel] ore.
RimeSteelDeposit.texts.flavor: A mysterious metal found only in the coldest environments. Said to be the only material that can pierce an [IceWorm]'s shell.
RimeSteelDeposit.texts.plural.name: Rimesteel Deposits

GemstoneDeposit.texts.name: Gemstone Deposit
GemstoneDeposit.texts.desc: You can build a [Mine] here to extract [Gemstone]s.
GemstoneDeposit.texts.plural.name: Gemstone Deposits

WolvesCave.texts.name: Wolf Den
WolvesCave.texts.desc: [Wolf]s will spawn in this zone until you claim it.
WolvesCave.texts.plural.name: Wolf Dens

Grove.texts.name: Forest
Grove.texts.desc: Improves [Wood] production in this zone by ::percent::.
Grove.texts.flavor: At Yule, Vikings would traditionally decorate large evergreen trees with carvings, gifts and food, urging spring to return faster.
Grove.texts.plural.name: Forests
Grove.franceTexts.name: Brocéliande
Grove.franceTexts.plural.name: Brocéliande
Grove.franceTexts.flavor: This is where the fairies, knights, enchantresses and sorcerers come when they need some drama.

DeerSpawner.texts.name: Deer
DeerSpawner.texts.desc: This zone is full of deer, making it a great place to hunt.
DeerSpawner.texts.plural.name: Deers

MarshBuilding.texts.name: Swamp
MarshBuilding.texts.desc: Unstable ground makes it harder to build in this zone.
MarshBuilding.texts.plural.name: Swamps

BrokenShores.texts.name: Shipwreck
BrokenShores.texts.desc: Colonize and use your [::unit::]s to explore this wreck, where you will find [Money] and [Wood].
BrokenShores.texts.plural.name: Shipwrecks

GiantCamp.texts.name: Jötunn Lair
GiantCamp.texts.desc: [GiantFaction]s build those lairs out of bones and stones.
GiantCamp.texts.plural.name: Jötunn Lairs
GiantCamp.franceTexts.name: Gayant Village
GiantCamp.franceTexts.plural.name: Gayant Villages

MyrkalfarHouse.texts.name: Myrkálf Camp
MyrkalfarHouse.texts.desc: These rudimentary houses are used by [MyrkalfarFaction]s as shelter and to send raids from.
MyrkalfarHouse.texts.plural.name: Myrkálf Camps
MyrkalfarHouse.franceTexts.name: Elbes' Lair
MyrkalfarHouse.franceTexts.desc: No living human has ever seen the inside of these elegant houses... nor has anyone ever wished to.
MyrkalfarHouse.franceTexts.plural.name: Elbes' Lairs

KoboldHouse.texts.name: Kobold Camp
KoboldHouse.texts.desc: Who knows how many [KoboldFaction]s live in those houses?
KoboldHouse.texts.plural.name: Kobold Camps
KoboldHouse.franceTexts.name: Farfadet Hut
KoboldHouse.franceTexts.desc: In [KoboldFaction] language, there is no word for hygiene. There is one for order, though. It's pronounced "chaos".
KoboldHouse.franceTexts.plural.name: Farfadet Huts

KoboldFirecamp.texts.name: Kobold Campfire
KoboldFirecamp.texts.plural.name: Kobold Campfires
KoboldFirecamp.franceTexts.name: Farfadet Campfire
KoboldFirecamp.franceTexts.desc: [KoboldFaction]s would eat anything, but they won't touch it unless it was roasted on this open fire.
KoboldFirecamp.franceTexts.plural.name: Farfadet Campfires

DwarfHouse.texts.name: Dwarven Grotto
DwarfHouse.texts.desc: Dwarves tend to organize themselves into corporations, for which it they will mine and forge.
DwarfHouse.texts.plural.name: Dwarven Grottos
DwarfHouse.franceTexts.name: Cavern of the Gnomes
DwarfHouse.franceTexts.desc: [DwarfFaction]s extract riches from the ground, but they also hide their riches into the ground. There is no point.
DwarfHouse.franceTexts.plural.name: Caverns of the Gnomes

GayantCamp.texts.name: Gayant Menhirs
GayantCamp.texts.desc: Despite their refined garments and culture, the Gayants stick to the old ways when it comes to landscaping.
GayantCamp.texts.plural.name: Gayant Menhirs

MarmennillCove.texts.name: Marmennill Cove
MarmennillCove.texts.desc: If some lived to tell the tale of their encounters with those sea creatures, many didn't and disappeared with their ships in those rough waters. Be careful how you treat them.
MarmennillCove.texts.plural.name: Marmennill Coves

DraugrPortal.texts.name: Draugr Portal
DraugrPortal.texts.desc: [Death]s will soon come pouring through this portal. We must prepare!
DraugrPortal.texts.plural.name: Draugr Portals

Vegvisir.texts.name: Vegvisir
Vegvisir.texts.desc: Increases building, repairing and forging speed by ::percent::.
Vegvisir.texts.plural.name: Vegvisir

ThorWrath.texts.name: Thor's Wrath
ThorWrath.texts.desc: An ancient place of power. Gives +::percent:: attack bonus to military units.
ThorWrath.texts.plural.name: Thor's Wraths

Geyser.texts.name: Geyser
Geyser.texts.desc: A warm and pleasant zone. Gives +::value::[Happy] and ::inv_percent1:: [Wood] consumption in winter if controlled.
Geyser.texts.plural.name: Geysers

AncientGraveyard.texts.name: Ancient Graveyard
AncientGraveyard.texts.desc: You can send [RuneMaster]s to study these burial grounds, and maybe find unexpected allies.
AncientGraveyard.texts.flavor: To a trained eye, it is obvious that Seidr, an ancient form of sorcery Freyia taught the Æsir, was practiced here.
AncientGraveyard.texts.plural.name: Ancient Graveyards

BrokenHouse.texts.name: Damaged House
BrokenHouse.texts.desc: Colonize and use your [::unit::]s to explore this house, where you will find [Money] and [Wood].
BrokenHouse.texts.plural.name: Damaged Houses

Bifrost.texts.name: Bifröst
Bifrost.texts.desc: The legendary bridge that leads to Asgard, where the major gods, the Æsir, are said to live. Protect it at all costs!
Bifrost.texts.flavor: "Bifröst" is believed to mean "shimmering path." The bridge is also called "Asbru," the Æsir's bridge.
Bifrost.texts.plural.name: Bifröst

BifrostLore.texts.name: Sleeping Bifröst
BifrostLore.texts.desc: You must colonize its zone first, then gather lore to activate this legendary Bridge.
BifrostLore.texts.plural.name: Sleeping Bifröst

Anvil.texts.name: Anvil of Gods
Anvil.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Smith]s. Allows you to forge the Sword of Odin.
Anvil.texts.plural.name: Anvil of Godss

Muspell.texts.name: Gate of Muspell
Muspell.texts.desc: This gateway connects Northgard and Muspelheim, the realm of fire. [GiantFire]s will spawn here until someone is brave enough to seal it.
Muspell.texts.flavor: Muspelheim is the southernmost of the nine worlds supported by the world tree Yggdrasil.
Muspell.texts.plural.name: Gates of Muspell

MuspellConquest.texts.name: Gate of Muspell
MuspellConquest.texts.desc: This gateway connects Northgard and Muspelheim, the realm of fire. [GiantFire]s will spawn here forever.
MuspellConquest.texts.flavor: Muspelheim is the southernmost of the nine worlds supported by the world tree Yggdrasil.
MuspellConquest.texts.plural.name: Gates of Muspell

Niflheim.texts.name: Gate of Niflheim
Niflheim.texts.desc: This gateway will summon armies of frozen warriors. There is no way to stop them, you must survive.
Niflheim.texts.plural.name: Gates of Niflheim

PillarOfGod.texts.name: Pillar of Glory
PillarOfGod.texts.desc: Assign a villager to become a [Scholar] who will produce [Fame].
PillarOfGod.texts.plural.name: Pillars of Glory

NidavellirGate.texts.name: Gate of Nidavellir
NidavellirGate.texts.desc: This huge gate leads directly to the realm of the underground and the kingdom of the dwarves.
NidavellirGate.texts.flavor: Approaching the door, you hear impacts and screams echoing through the tunnels... someone must have dropped their pickaxe.
NidavellirGate.texts.plural.name: Gates of Nidavellir

FountainFame.texts.name: Mimirsbrunn
FountainFame.texts.desc: Assign a [Villager] to become a [RuneMaster] and produce [Lore]. They may discover new Knowledge from another clan (doesn't count for Lore Victory).
FountainFame.texts.plural.name: Mimirsbrunn

FountainHealth.texts.name: Urdarbrunn
FountainHealth.texts.desc: Gives a ::percent:: bonus of [Healing] to all your healers. Allows the use of [Cleanse] ability.
FountainHealth.texts.plural.name: Urdarbrunn

TallGrass.texts.name: Landvidi
TallGrass.texts.desc: Don’t get lost in the tall grass. All units inside gain [Invisibility], which makes them undetectable to the outside.
TallGrass.texts.plural.name: Landvidis
TallGrass.franceTexts.name: Tall Grass
TallGrass.franceTexts.desc: All units inside gain [Invisibility], which makes them undetectable to the outside.
TallGrass.franceTexts.plural.name: Tall Grasses

HidingGrass.texts.name: Tall Grass
HidingGrass.texts.desc: A thick patch of grass, perfect to hide from some pesky patrols.
HidingGrass.texts.plural.name: Tall Grasses
HidingGrass.franceTexts.name: Tall Grass
HidingGrass.franceTexts.desc: A thick patch of grass, perfect to hide from some pesky patrols.
HidingGrass.franceTexts.plural.name: Tall Grasses
HidingGrass.editor.name: Tall Grass Campaign

PoisonousSwamp.texts.name: Poisonous Swamp
PoisonousSwamp.texts.desc: Spread a poisonous gas which hurts and slows down anything that pass through.
PoisonousSwamp.texts.plural.name: Poisonous Swamps

BrambleField.texts.name: Naströnd
BrambleField.texts.desc: Thick thorns prevent anything from passing except the most agile of men. They can be cleared by a [::unit::] and will give some [Wood] afterward.
BrambleField.texts.plural.name: Naströnds
BrambleField.franceTexts.name: Roncier des aboyeuses
BrambleField.franceTexts.plural.name: Ronciers des aboyeuses
BrambleField.franceTexts.flavor: It is said that this bramble can give vision to the blind. What's certain is that its pointy thorns can easily take the vision back.

BrambleFieldCampaign.texts.name: Naströnd
BrambleFieldCampaign.texts.desc: Thick thorns prevent anything from passing except the most agile of men.
BrambleFieldCampaign.texts.plural.name: Naströnds
BrambleFieldCampaign.editor.name: Nastrond Campaign

CeremonialBonfire.texts.name: Ceremonial Bonfire
CeremonialBonfire.texts.desc:
The Bonfire is built on a sacred site that produces ::value:: [Lore].
Everybody can contribute to the construction
by sending [Wood]!
CeremonialBonfire.texts.flavor: The smell of the burning pine tree sap is really typical of this event.
CeremonialBonfire.texts.plural.name: Ceremonial Bonfires
CeremonialBonfire.franceTexts.name: Saint John's Nied Fyr
CeremonialBonfire.franceTexts.desc: When the summer solstice comes, the Nied Fyr is lit. Everybody can contribute to the construction by sending [Wood]!
CeremonialBonfire.franceTexts.plural.name: Saint John's Nied Fyrs
CeremonialBonfire.franceTexts.flavor: It's not pagan anymore if it bears the name of a Saint.

SpiderDen.texts.name: Spider Den
SpiderDen.texts.desc: [Spider]s will spawn in this zone until you claim it.
SpiderDen.texts.flavor: It's probably a good idea to leave those eggs alone.
SpiderDen.texts.plural.name: Spider Dens

DefensiveSpikes.texts.name: Spike Barricade
DefensiveSpikes.texts.desc: As long as the [DefensiveSpikes] stands, all enemy units entering the zone will suffer injuries, damaging the building in the process.
DefensiveSpikes.texts.plural.name: Spike Barricades

Foxhole.texts.name: Fox Burrow
Foxhole.texts.desc: [Fox]s will spawn from the burrow, until it is closed.
Foxhole.texts.plural.name: Fox Burrows

Meteor.texts.name: Molten Rock
Meteor.texts.desc: An unnatural glow surrounds this rock. Mine it quickly or face the magic within!
Meteor.texts.plural.name: Molten Rocks

Snowman.texts.name: Snowman
Snowman.texts.desc: A long lasting snowman thanks to the "lovely" weather of Northgard.
Snowman.texts.flavor: Do you wanna build a snowman?
Snowman.texts.plural.name: Snowmen

Scarecrow.texts.name: Scarecrow
Scarecrow.texts.desc: A vaguely humanoid construct made from sticks and rags. Dubious enough to keep all kinds of birds at bay.
Scarecrow.texts.plural.name: Scarecrows

RelicHammer.texts.name: Mjöllnir
RelicHammer.texts.desc:
Forging time is ::forgeSpeedFactor::% faster.
When landing a strike, upgraded units have a ::lightningChance::% chance of summoning Mjölnir's wrath on their opponents.
RelicHammer.texts.plural.name: Mjöllnirs

RelicPot.texts.name: Gefjun's Jar
RelicPot.texts.desc:
Population [Happy] requirements are reduced by ::inv_percent0::.
The more you have, the more your units' production is increased.
RelicPot.texts.plural.name: Gefjun's Jars

RelicPillar.texts.name: Jörmunr
RelicPillar.texts.desc: You gain a [Lore] bonus depending on number of zones in your territory. You can colonize zones with Lore.
RelicPillar.texts.plural.name: Jörmunrs

RelicStag.texts.name: Hlidskjalf
RelicStag.texts.desc: Allows you to recruit [Einherjar]s at [RelicStag]. Powerful units consuming more [Food] but whose strength increases with the clan's [Fame].
RelicStag.texts.plural.name: Hlidskjalfs

RelicGoat.texts.name: Eldhrumnir
RelicGoat.texts.desc: Your clan gets ::percent0:: more production through feasts, ::inv_percent1:: Feast cost reduction.
RelicGoat.texts.plural.name: Eldhrumnirs

RelicWolf.texts.name: Horn of Managarm
RelicWolf.texts.desc: Summons up to 3 [WhiteWolf]s under your control.
RelicWolf.texts.plural.name: Horn of Managarms

RelicRaven.texts.name: Naglfar
RelicRaven.texts.desc:
Raven ships are unsinkable and are no longer affected by Kraken or Frozen Sea event.
A [GiantCrow] joins every mercenary raid.
RelicRaven.texts.plural.name: Naglfars

RelicBear.texts.name: Scabbard of Gram
RelicBear.texts.desc: Your Warchief wields the sword Gram. Enemies hit by Gram are frozen, along with the area around them. Gives +::percent:: attack, +::percent1:: defense to Shield Maiden.
RelicBear.texts.plural.name: Scabbard of Grams

RelicBoar.texts.name: Mask of Gullinbursti
RelicBoar.texts.desc:
Produce +::value1:: [Food].
You can pay ::cost:: to summon one [GiantBoar]. It is controllable as long as it is not in combat.
RelicBoar.texts.plural.name: Mask of Gullinburstis

RelicSnake.texts.name: Gungnir
RelicSnake.texts.desc:
All military units get ::percent:: dodge chance.
Unlocks the [Stealth] ability for all your military units.
RelicSnake.texts.plural.name: Gungnirs

RelicHorse.texts.name: Dainsleif & Tyrfing
RelicHorse.texts.desc: Your Warchiefs gain ::percent:: Attack power, Defense, and Health. Their mining and forging speed is also increased by ::percent3::.
RelicHorse.texts.plural.name: Dainsleif & Tyrfings

RelicKraken.texts.name: Edda of Vor
RelicKraken.texts.desc:
You can force the Kraken's Event.
During Kraken's event, if any boat is destroyed you will receive resources.
RelicKraken.texts.plural.name: Edda of Vors

RelicOx.texts.name: Aegir
RelicOx.texts.desc: [OxHero] can use [Provocation]: all enemy units and towers target [OxHero] during a short period and his defense is increased by ::percent1:: for ::value:: seconds.
RelicOx.texts.plural.name: Aegirs

RelicLynx.texts.name: Gleipnir
RelicLynx.texts.desc: Place a trap in a non-enemy zone. Activate on demand to reveal spikes that damage and slow down the enemy as long as they stay within. Lasts ::value1:: seconds.
RelicLynx.texts.plural.name: Gleipnirs

RelicSquirrel.texts.name: Yggdrasil's Root
RelicSquirrel.texts.desc:
The zone where Yggdrasil's Root is built becomes “Eldritch".
Every ::value:: months, another controlled zone becomes eldritch.
Units in Eldritch zones benefit from periodical production bonuses.
Enemy units in an eldritch zone have a chance to pick a fight with their own kin for 5s.
RelicSquirrel.texts.plural.name: Yggdrasil's Roots

RelicEagle.texts.name: Vídópnir’s Feather
RelicEagle.texts.desc:
[Treasure]s have a chance to become [CursedTreasure].
For each [Treasure] or [CursedTreasure] opened, you get a permanent +::percent_value:: attack power bonus for all your military units (max ::percent_value1::).
RelicEagle.texts.plural.name: Relic Eagle

RelicPhilosopher.texts.name: Altar of Volvinius
RelicPhilosopher.texts.desc: All resources produced in the zone are replaced with [Money] and all deaths in the zone generate [Money].
RelicPhilosopher.texts.flavor: There is more to life than money. Death on the other hand...

RelicFaith.texts.name: Codex Aureus
RelicFaith.texts.desc: Population increase and productivity now require [Faith] instead of [Happy]. [Faith] production in the zone is increased by +::percent::.
RelicFaith.texts.flavor: 100% of the people who commit to a vow of silence, are never heard complaining again. Satisfaction guaranteed.

RelicRevive.texts.name: Lance of Longinus
RelicRevive.texts.desc: Clan units who died within the Lance's zone can be revived in exchange for [Faith].

RelicChalice.texts.name: Holy Fire
RelicChalice.texts.desc:
Feast costs are reduced by ::inv_percent::, and consume [Wood] instead of [Food].
During a feast, all your units inside your territory inflict burning attacks.
If outside your territory, all your units in the zone of the relic inflict burning attacks.

Yggdrasil.texts.name: Yggdrasil
Yggdrasil.texts.desc: The world tree is threatened by evil forces.
Yggdrasil.texts.plural.name: Yggdrasil

WyvernDen.texts.name: Wyvern's Den
WyvernDen.texts.desc: Fight the Wyvern to earn many [Fame] and [MilitaryXP]
WyvernDen.texts.flavor: Everything is under control as long as the Wyvern is asleep ...
WyvernDen.texts.plural.name: Wyvern's Dens
WyvernDen.franceTexts.name: Pedestal of the Vouivre
WyvernDen.franceTexts.plural.name: Pedestals of the Vouivre
WyvernDen.franceTexts.flavor: Does it mean someone deliberately put the [Wyvern] here? Or did the beast appropriate someone else's pedestal?

BigSword.texts.name: Sword of the Gods
BigSword.texts.desc: Assign your villagers to become [RuneMaster]s. All [!RuneMaster]s in this zone will produce ::percent:: more [Lore].
BigSword.texts.plural.name: Sword of the Gods
BigSword.franceTexts.name: Durandal
BigSword.franceTexts.desc: While norse clans can study this ancient sword, southern kingdoms can build religious edifices around it, stimulating [Faith] and [Money] production by ::percent1::.
BigSword.franceTexts.flavor: When Roland abandoned his mythical sword here, he was quite confident that no one would be able to take it away.

Helheim.texts.name: Gate of Helheim
Helheim.texts.desc: This portal connects Northgard to Helheim, the realm of the dead. [Valkyrie]s and [Death]s will spawn here until someone is brave enough to confront them.
Helheim.texts.plural.name: Gates of Helheim
Helheim.franceTexts.name: Yeun Elez
Helheim.franceTexts.desc: In this peatland stands an open door to the realm of the dead.
Helheim.franceTexts.plural.name: Yeun Elez
Helheim.franceTexts.flavor: The Ankou, reaper of mortal souls, is believed to use this portal for work.

MagmaFlow.texts.name: Magma Flow
MagmaFlow.texts.desc: The molten lava in this zone can be used to craft very powerful weapons.
MagmaFlow.texts.plural.name: Magma Flows

Volcano.texts.name: Volcano
Volcano.texts.desc: A dangerous active volcano. Watch out for flying [Meteor]s!
Volcano.texts.plural.name: Volcanoes

IceThrone.texts.name: Seal of Valhalla
IceThrone.texts.desc: By controling this seal, [LichKing] prevent souls to go to Valhalla and bring them back as draugar.
IceThrone.texts.plural.name: Seal of Valhallas

FountainBarenton.texts.name: Barenton Fountain
FountainBarenton.texts.desc: Gives control over the events and calamities that will strike the earth next.
FountainBarenton.texts.flavor: Some believe its water can cure madness. Others think it causes insanity. Surely that's a matter of perspective.

Arena.texts.name: Arena
Arena.texts.desc: Every year, the strongest warriors gather in this arena until only one is left.

BabyWyvernDen.texts.name: Wyvern's Nest
BabyWyvernDen.texts.desc: An abandoned nest with eggs still inside. Who knows what could come out of it?
BabyWyvernDen.texts.flavor: I wouldn't recommend setting them on fire if that's what you're thinking about.
BabyWyvernDen.texts.plural.name: Wyvern's Nests

Banquet01.texts.name: Lumberjack's Break
Banquet01.texts.flavor: The remnants of a grove now serving as a makeshift table for lumberjacks.
Banquet01.texts.plural.name: Lumberjack's Breaks

Banquet02.texts.name: Warrior's Breakfast
Banquet02.texts.flavor: A plain, purely functional table with benches, for warriors to eat up their breakfast quickly. Always messy.
Banquet02.texts.plural.name: Warrior's Breakfasts

Banquet03.texts.name: The 'Immovable'
Banquet03.texts.flavor: A very sturdy set of table and benches, bolted into the ground. Can last for several decades, provided you never unbolt them.
Banquet03.texts.plural.name: The 'Immovable's

Banquet04.texts.name: Jarl's Table
Banquet04.texts.flavor: A lavish table with a throne, used only by a Jarl and their occasional distinguished guests.
Banquet04.texts.plural.name: Jarl's Tables

Banquet05.texts.name: A Wolf's Delight
Banquet05.texts.flavor: The top of this table is a bit sticky of all the meat juice and mead spilled over it, and smells accordingly, too.
Banquet05.texts.plural.name: A Wolf's Delights

Banquet06.texts.name: The Twins' Party
Banquet06.texts.flavor: A set of stone table and benches that can withstand the weight of several drunken, dancing Vikings.
Banquet06.texts.plural.name: The Twins' Partys

Fireplace01.texts.name: Lancers' Campfire
Fireplace01.texts.flavor: A low-key place for scouts and skirmishers to take a break at in the wild.
Fireplace01.texts.plural.name: Lancers' Campfires

Fireplace02.texts.name: The All-Father's Bane
Fireplace02.texts.flavor: When lit, this bonfire represent Odin's standing helplessly before the flames of Muspell. Instills dread to those who sit around.
Fireplace02.texts.plural.name: The All-Father's Banes

Fireplace03.texts.name: Golden Boar
Fireplace03.texts.flavor: When lit, this bonfire resembles the legendary boar Gullinbursti, with its tusks and flaming bristles.
Fireplace03.texts.plural.name: Golden Boars

Fireplace04.texts.name: Funeral Pyre
Fireplace04.texts.flavor: This pyre commemorates the Vikings that fell while serving you. Instills sadness but also pride to anyone who sits around it.
Fireplace04.texts.plural.name: Funeral Pyres

Fireplace05.texts.name: Drunkard's Relief
Fireplace05.texts.flavor: The dual kegs allow for several Vikings to quench their thirst without even having to stand up.
Fireplace05.texts.plural.name: Drunkard's Reliefs

Fireplace06.texts.name: Jötnar's Oven
Fireplace06.texts.flavor: The humanoid remains around this big campfire do not inspire much trust to those who sit around it, but hey, a campfire is a campfire.
Fireplace06.texts.plural.name: Jötnar's Ovens

Fireplace07.texts.name: Gaul Trap
Fireplace07.texts.flavor: A whole boar roasts gently on a spit over this campfire, which was known as a reliable way to attract gourmet Gauls ages ago.
Fireplace07.texts.plural.name: Gaul Traps

Gate01.texts.name: The Kraken's Embrace
Gate01.texts.flavor: A decorative gate in the form of two tentacles. The more superstitious sailors will adamantly refuse to go through it.
Gate01.texts.plural.name: The Kraken's Embraces

Gate02.texts.name: Lovers' Threshold
Gate02.texts.flavor: A gate that lovers cross together to show that they are symbolically ready to marry each other. It is believed that not marrying after doing so will bring them bad luck in their future relationships.
Gate02.texts.plural.name: Lovers' Thresholds

Gate03.texts.name: Ivaldi's Sons
Gate03.texts.flavor: A wooden carved frame representing two dwarves holding each other's shoulder. Usually used as a decorative entrance into a craftsmen's fair.
Gate03.texts.plural.name: Ivaldi's Sonss

Gate04.texts.name: Oblivious Dragons
Gate04.texts.flavor: A wooden carved gate representing two dragons looking away. It is crossed only by elderly or heavily handicapped warriors that can no longer fight and have to lay down their weapons, hoping to still go to Valhöll doing so.
Gate04.texts.plural.name: Oblivious Dragonss

Gate05.texts.name: Cursed Gate
Gate05.texts.flavor: Seidr witches secretly order these creepy gates with carved human faces on them, to drive the nosy persons away from their business, as the unitiated believe the carvings are the spirits of cursed persons trapped in the wood.
Gate05.texts.plural.name: Cursed Gates

Gate06.texts.name: Dolmen
Gate06.texts.flavor: These structures have been around for ages and no one really knows who built them. The tradition continues, although nobody really knows what they represent.
Gate06.texts.plural.name: Dolmens

Gate07.texts.name: The 'Jötunnheimer'
Gate07.texts.flavor: A gate made out of some giant marine creature's remains, usually (but not always) built by the Jötnar. People usually love it or hate it, with no middle ground.
Gate07.texts.plural.name: The 'Jötunnheimer's

Lighting01.texts.name: Lancers' Beacon
Lighting01.texts.flavor: A torch pole with weapons leaning on and lying around it, so as to be ready in case of attack.
Lighting01.texts.plural.name: Lancers' Beacons

Lighting02.texts.name: Freyja's Wink
Lighting02.texts.flavor: A pole topped with a brazier and decorated with vegetal garlands, believed to find favour with Freyja.
Lighting02.texts.plural.name: Freyja's Winks

Lighting03.texts.name: Enlightened Bannerman
Lighting03.texts.flavor: A beacon used mostly as a gathering point for warriors before going into battle. Inspires courage and unity.
Lighting03.texts.plural.name: Enlightened Bannermans

Lighting04.texts.name: Crossroads
Lighting04.texts.flavor: A beacon used to light up crossroads. Plain, but very sturdy and functional.
Lighting04.texts.plural.name: Crossroadss

Lighting05.texts.name: Drake's Glare
Lighting05.texts.flavor: A pole topped with a metallic casing resembling a drake. Used to mimic a magical creature and inspire fear to the enemies, with its eyes glowing in the dark.
Lighting05.texts.plural.name: Drake's Glares

Lighting06.texts.name: The 'Bad Omen'
Lighting06.texts.flavor: A twisted wooden husk that was once a magnificent tree, with skulls lying by its roots. It is believed to be a very bad omen, so most people will look away from it.
Lighting06.texts.plural.name: The 'Bad Omen's

Totem01.texts.name: Wooden Carved Pole
Totem01.texts.flavor: Brings a proud smirk to the face of the townsfolks who look at it. Teen couples carve their initials on it, despite the custom being frowned upon by the elderly.
Totem01.texts.plural.name: Wooden Carved Poles

Totem02.texts.name: Stone Carved Pole
Totem02.texts.flavor: Inspires some confidence to the townsfolks who look at it. Moss gathers in the cracks, so it smells really nice after rainfalls.
Totem02.texts.plural.name: Stone Carved Poles

Totem03.texts.name: Iron Cared Pole
Totem03.texts.flavor: Inspires a strong feeling of unity to the townsfolks who look at it. The iron and wooden structure reminds everyone that victory requires a collective effort.
Totem03.texts.plural.name: Iron Cared Poles

Totem04.texts.name: Gold Carved Pole
Totem04.texts.flavor: Inspires a lot of pride and might to the townsfolks who look at it. The golden parts shimmer brightly when the sun shine upon them, urging everyone not let themselves be blinded by hubris.
Totem04.texts.plural.name: Gold Carved Poles

Totem05.texts.name: Rimesteel Carved Pole
Totem05.texts.flavor: Inspires a feeling of invincibility to the townsfolks who look at it. Extreme cold emanates from the rimesteel parts of the monument as a reminder that victory always comes at a price.
Totem05.texts.plural.name: Rimesteel Carved Poles

ColliderSquare.texts.name: Square Collider
ColliderSquare.texts.desc: An invisible square collider to give consistence to decorative elements.
ColliderSquare.texts.plural.name: Square Colliders

ColliderRectangle.texts.name: Rectangle Collider
ColliderRectangle.texts.desc: An invisible rectangle collider to give consistence to decorative elements.
ColliderRectangle.texts.plural.name: Rectangle Colliders

ColliderOcto.texts.name: Octagonal Collider
ColliderOcto.texts.desc: An invisible octagonal collider to give consistence to decorative elements.
ColliderOcto.texts.plural.name: Octagonal Colliders

RelicGeneric.texts.name: Relic
RelicGeneric.texts.desc: You must create a relic in the [Forge] before you can build it.
RelicGeneric.texts.plural.name: Relics

RelicShield.texts.name: Svalinn
RelicShield.texts.desc: +::percent0:: defense for units in this zone. Can be moved into another zone within your territory. Protects the zone against some negative effects that target it.
RelicShield.texts.plural.name: Svalinns

RelicCup.texts.name: Bragaful
RelicCup.texts.desc: You gain a [Money] bonus depending of your [Prestige]. Your [Lighthouse] has a fourth great trade route (-60 [Money], +20 [Prestige], +9 [Happy])
RelicCup.texts.plural.name: Bragafuls

Wolf.name: Wolf
Wolf.title: The Clan of the Wolf
Wolf.desc: Born fighters, the strong people of Fenrir are exceptionally fierce on the battlefield. Their bravery not only allows them to hunt for survival, compensating for their meager production. It also gives them the ability to mobilize fast and recklessly push into enemy territories.

line0.desc: Killing [Wolf]s and [Bear]s provides [Meat].

line1.desc: Your military units consume ::inv_percent:: less [Food] and provide [Happy].

line2.desc: If you have no military units, the first recruitment is free.

Stag.name: Stag
Stag.title: The Clan of the Stag
Stag.desc: Glorious and flourishing, the citizens of Eikthyrnir are known for their flawless productivity and can always count on plentiful resources. Followed by the artful praise of their skalds, they make history wherever they go.

line0.desc: You start with +::value::[Food], +::value1::[Wood], +::value2::[Money] and +::value3::[Lore].

line1.desc: The [HallOfPoetry] replaces the [Tavern].

line2.desc: You gain ::percent:: more [Fame] and [Happy] from your territory.

Goat.name: Goat
Goat.title: The Clan of the Goat
Goat.desc: Bringers of abundance, the laborers of Heidrun are expert stockbreeders and hold feast after feast with admirable ease. Although they know how to defend what they have, they aren't known for their fierceness in combat.

line0.desc: Starts with one [Sheep] and can build two [Sheepfold]s.

line1.desc: Your clan gets ::percent:: more production through feasts.

Raven.name: Raven
Raven.title: The Clan of the Raven
Raven.desc: Prosperous seafarers, the sailors of Huginn and Muninn use their unmatched commercial ability to expand at great speed, and their navigation mastery to explore or raid distant areas.

line0.desc: You can spend [Money] to colonize new zones.

line1.desc: [RavenPort] replaces the [Port].

line2.desc: You gain [Lore] when you scout new zones and [Fame] when you discover Neutral Factions and enemy [TownHall]s.

Bear.name: Bear
Bear.title: The Clan of the Bear
Bear.desc: Lords of the frost, the brood of Bjarki reach their full potential in winter. Protected by the vigorous Shield Maiden and her armored bear Kaija, their defenses allow it to wait until the cold comes. Then, they can send their most vigorous troops at their crippled rivals.

line0.desc: Food and Firewood penalties in winter are reduced by ::inv_percent::.

line1.desc: You can summon [BearMaiden] to your [TrainingCamp]. It regenerates and produce [Food] near [Shoal].

line2.desc: Instead of having reduced power, your military units gain ::percent:: resistance bonus during the winter.

Boar.name: Boar
Boar.title: The Clan of the Boar
Boar.desc: One with nature, the resilient settlers of Slidrugtanni can prosper with very little resources and comfort, making survival way easier. Their rudimentary and reclusive lifestyle allowed their wise menders to develop a vast firsthand knowledge of this world, its secrets and its lore.

line0.desc: The [MenderHut] replaces the [HealerHut].

line1.desc: Can colonize neutral zones with wild life for an extra cost. [Wolf]s and [Bear]s in the colonized zone become friendly and won't attack your units.

line2.desc: Each additional territory gives ::value:: max population.

line3.desc: Unlocking new Knowledge gives a +::value:: Fame bonus.

line4.desc: No penalties to [Happy] for non-upgraded [House]s and [TownHall].

line5.desc: The clan can only trade with neutral factions.

Snake.name: Snake
Snake.title: The Clan of the Snake
